characters: JENNY HAYDN GAVE BIRTH TO AN EIGHT-POUND, SEVEN-OUNCE BAB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wail of a siren grows out of the distance and very fa through the fog we see the headlights and flashing blue r lights of a police car coming toward us. It drops into a  dip, reappears almost immediately, hurtling down the cent of the deserted highway. It gets closer and closer until lights and siren fill our senses then zooms past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frightened SECURITY GUARD is tensed forward off the bac seat, his hands clutched into the fabric between the two  regular POLICE OFFICERS in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an edge of fear in  his voice) It's coming up... Slow down... (he points out between  them) There, right there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield we can see the headlights pick up billboard announcing a 'new' housing development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car skids off the asphalt in front of the sign starts up a rutted dirt road. The sign tells us we are he for 'Pinewood Estates,' a housing development financed by the Farmers Bank of Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Guard is becoming more agitated. He wipes a  cold sweat off his brow. The blue flashers reflect off th fog onto the faces of the men. Suddenly the Security Guar lunges forward and slaps off the rack lights and siren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Benny, God, take it easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to scare them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Police Officers exchange an indulgent look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using only its parking lights, the police car creeps up t dirt road between skeletons of unfinished houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows are rolled down. Periodically one of the men  leans out for a better look at the terrain around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells smoke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car comes around a curve on the hillside and s Above them on the next hill, a necklace of embers from a  grass fire and a burning tree flicker through the fog. Th men get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) There!! Up on the hill!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer steps forward for a better look. Benny hangs his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right in line with that burning tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's there. The fog's thicker now,  but it's there. What do you think  started those fires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer strains to see through the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny, there's nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is. They came out of the belly  of the ship and then went to the  first terrace and flew down into the  houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flew?! Oh, come on Benny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second officer is peering intently at something down  among the houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, Mike? Now he's telling  us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny and the officer look to where Mike is pointing. Wha appears to be the beam of a powerful headlight bobs among the houses below them. Further into the track another bea of light moves slightly from right to left but seems othe stationary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the lights rises over a house and settles on the o side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not convinced) Probably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light shines directly into our eyes. As it swings away  from us we realize that it was the searchlight on the pol car which is idling along the dirt road with its running  lights off. The fire on the hill gives the fog down here red tint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police officers are beginning to feel anxious. Benny' nervous fidgeting in the back seat doesn't help them any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you should call a  backup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car passes a road perpendicular to the one it on. A couple of houses down that road a faint glow spills over the sides of an industrial dumpster. As we watch we  hear an eerie high pitched whistle, a shaft of light slow rises out of the metal box and seems to fly off between t houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a humanoid silhouette passes in front of the picture  window, a shaft of light floats by in the fog outside. Th silhouette continues around to look at the kitchen. It ra a hand to eye level. There is a sharp "SNAP" and a hard-e cone of light shoots out of the darkness to capture the i of the kitchen and pulls back a three-dimensional image o stove, sink, cupboards, electrical fixtures and walls to silhouette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car is parked in the middle of the dirt road.  Benny and the officers are intent on a light that reaches them only in strobes as it moves through the houses in th direction of the fire on the hill. The police searchlight swings onto the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over outside speakers) This is the police. Identify  yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is deathly silent. Carrying a shotgun the officer motions Benny and Mike to out on either side of him and, guns drawn, they cut acros the tract to where they last saw the bobbing light. The fog quickly isolates them, heightening their fear. Ea man becomes acutely aware of the loudness of his breathin and the crunch of his footsteps on the ground. They drift and out of visual contact with each other. Benny freezes as he hears a burst of the high pitched whi sweep by on his left. He turns slowly to see, through the ribs of an unfinished house, a shaft of the white light  pointing at a cement mixer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the officers, his  voice cracking) There's one over here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brilliant light swings toward him. Benny, his hands  trembling, raises the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!! Police!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light fixes on Benny and terrified he shakes off a co shots. The light goes out immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Benny's direction) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I shot one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Benny. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking at the back of the humanoid figure. It cro to a high window and looks out. The reddish tinge of the outlines him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men strain to see something through the silent fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anything, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Mike can answer, a strange percussive clicking sou is heard. He pumps a shell in the chamber of his shotgun swallowing his fear moves toward the voices. They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the police. Identify  yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny, his flashlight throwing a feeble beam in front of  him, inches around the house looking for what he shot at. gets to where it should be but it's not there. His light  searches the area. There is nothing but a stack of lumber Shaking visibly he shuffles to it and peers around its co Nothing. Benny relaxes and allows himself to breathe agai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts to the officers) You wanna give me some help over  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny continues around the house. He flashes his light in a doorway. There is nothing but framing. When he moves on figure steps out of the darkness to fill the space, then  raises its arms. With a sharp snap cylindrical devices sw off its wrist into its hands. At the corner of the house Benny hears the snap and stops The high pitched whistle starts behind him. He stumbles a to face a brilliant white light flying directly at him. B screams in terror and fires at it. The light swerves and laser streak from one of the hand rockets sears Benny's c and knocks him to the ground in pain. Holding his shoulde he watches the light rise and fall erratically between th houses. The officers watch in awe as the beam wobbles through the air, then crashes to the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, call for back-up. (shouting) Benny, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so... (clutching his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the beam of  his flashlight, shouts) Benny, this is me. I'm going to take  a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny's beam flashes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me. I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men begin to trot toward the light. It swings wil around and, accompanied by the high-pitched whistle, star to stagger back up the hill. Benny and the officer break  into a run. They are on their way up the hill when the li in front of them crashes to the earth. It rolls over and  lays still, the beam shooting straight up into the air. B and the officer slow their pursuit, terrified of what the might find. Suddenly a high-pitched whistle is bearing do on them from behind. Before they can turn a light rockets over their heads. With a rumble the hill begins to vibrat As they follow its flight, they see lights beginning to r to life across the skin of a saucer-shaped spacecraft res at the edge of the forest on top of the hill. With a rumb the hill begins to vibrate. Frightened, the officers stop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humanoid figure walks rapidly down the hall into the  kitchen. An indistinct image plays on the inside of its  faceplate and we hear the faint sounds of a percussive  language. Through the window over the sink we can see the lights of the spaceship. The rockets flip into the humanoid's gloved hands and it airborne out the open back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the road Benny and the officer watch as the humanoid figure that just blasted over them flies between the tree and into the white light emitting from the underbelly of spacecraft. The noise from the ship's power plant is deaf as it begins to rise above the trees. With Mike at the wheel the police car, its rack lights  flashing, fishtails up the dirt road and slides sideways a bone-jarring stop next to Benny and the officer. As the jump out of the way they find themselves facing into the  super white beam of the figure that was in the house. The are between it and the ship. At the angle that it is comi up the hill, the light looks like it is heading directly them. This is too much for the officer and in terror he r his shotgun and fires wildly at it. The figure veers off disappears into the fog. With an awesome roar the spacecraft reaches escape veloci and hurtles into the night sky. The concussion waves knoc Benny and the officers off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escaped figure's light comes out of the fog at tree  height. We hear the high-pitched whistle of its rockets. burst of percussive language comes from behind the facepl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lander four to Mapmaker Wind. Fix  position for rescue. Repeat. Fix  position for rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fires on the hillside have been renewed. Shaking, Ben and the officer rise to their feet and start toward the l shafting straight up from the figure lying on the hillsid The only sound is police chatter coming out of the radio the open squad car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An 18-wheeler with a load of logs lumbers past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels cozy with the wipers slapping the rain off the  windshield. The DRIVER is trying to steal a cigarette out his snoring PARTNER'S pocket without waking him up. He ge one and reaches for the lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escaped figure banks around a blind corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver gets a glimpse of something in his headlights slams on the brakes, but it is too late. The figure hits spoiler above the cab. We hear the smack of impact. One o its boots scars the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure bounces off the jack-knifing truck and like a  wounded bird tumbles through the air into the trees. With the light spinning crazily, it plunges through the boughs and smashes face first into the mud at the bottom of an  embankment. The strip lights on the sides of its helmet g out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver and his partner, standing in the shafts of the high beams, are peering into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was it anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damned if I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure thrashes over on its back and tries to close a shoulder-to-hip tear in its life-support suit. By the fai identification light that flickers on and off inside its  helmet, we see a MAN FROM THE STARS. His skin is transluc coral. He is gasping as our atmosphere mixes with his and threatens to suffocate him. Under his translucent skin a maze of veins and arteries e from a white mass that sits in the upper half of his head He is hairless. Underneath a graceful fore-head, transpar eyelids droop over black pupilless eyes. The thin lips th delineate his mouth are chalk-white. He tries to clutch the edges of the tear together but is weak. His hands drop limply from the suit, allowing the r to gape open and reveal the translucent body underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I'm getting wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It musta been a bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if I drive now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the faceplate a piece of white light breaks off fr the shining mass in the STAR MAN'S head and moves down hi neck. Through the hole in the suit we see it arrive at th top of his single lung. The white light spreads throughou the organ like a phosphorescent tide. The STAR MAN lapses into unconsciousness as we hear the truck pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light rain is falling. We are looking through the windscreen at the gray landsca passing under the helicopter. MARC SHERMIN, a grizzled ma in his mid-fifties with an honest stubborn face, shifts h attention from the right side to the left side of the cra Below him he can see the road leading into the housing tr is blocked by police cars. The helicopter leans into a ba turn and the spacecraft's blackened landing site comes in view. Below it an orange nylon tent has been erected over the dead extraterrestrial. It glows from the inside. An A Force helicopter is parked on the other side of the burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man in a white contamination suit is helping Benny and two officers into the Air Force helicopter. The three men are glassy-eyed and wrapped in blankets. Benny has a band across his chest. They look up at Shermin's descending  helicopter. They are still looking at it when they disapp inside. Shermin's unmarked S65 settles on the clearing. The nose  door is open and Shermin, carrying the hood of his  contamination suit, comes down the ladder. A tall homespu man, also in a hoodless contamination suit, steps forward greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (around a cigarette) Major Aaron Bell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marc Shermin, National Security  Agency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin takes a moment to look over at the tent, the gree hillside and the forest beyond. It is pastoral in the sof light of dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has always been my favorite  time of day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very beautiful country up here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any signs of biological contamination,  excessive radiation, anything like  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on the landscape. We're trying  to get a tube under the faceplate  for a reading on possible deadly  lifeforms but it's hard going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see under the faceplate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell's hands shake as he lights a new cigarette off the o in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a good chance you could be  wrong about this thing then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait'll you see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws away the cigarette and begins to put on his  contamination hood. Shermin follows as they start for the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a flight of F16's play tag  with the spaceship over Michigan for  an hour. Then it shot straight up  and disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there visual contact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could have been anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooded, Bell and Shermin make their way past three suited scientists examining the landscape with geiger counters a other sensing instruments. With the coming of dawn and Be handlight we can clearly see the pod indentations and the huge black glass cup of earth that was fused by the energ blasting out of the spaceship's power plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I called in, I had a chance to  sit down with the three locals. They  swear there's another one that didn't  make the ship... It might be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People have made mistakes in these  situations before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been investigating sightings  for seventeen years, Mr. Shermin.  This one's real. We have a dead extra- terrestrial in that tent and another  one in the area that might be alive.  We've been visited. It's finally  happened and the sooner Washington  accepts that and starts figuring out  how we're going to deal with these  beings, the better off we're going  to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is still raining. The STAR MAN stirs and awakens with a start. He parts the tear in his suit and looks at his lung through his transl body. It has changed in color from brown to a rich yellow ocher. He takes several deep breaths of our atmosphere an his lung expands and contracts easily. He conducts a quic inventory of his damaged spacesuit, then struggles to his knees and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a powerful slow-speed drill greets Bell and  Shermin as they enter. The extraterrestrial is still on i back with its helmet lights shining straight up. A hose t extends from a portable gas chromatograph has been suctio sealed to a corner of the faceplate. A SCIENTIST is makin adjustments at the chromatograph while his COMPANION is  monitoring the progress of the drill into the faceplate.  Both are wearing contamination suits. A foam-lined coffin-shaped metal box is on the ground nex to one of the walls. Bell and Shermin approach the body.  Shermin's first look is at the faceplate, but all he can is his own reflection. His eyes travel down the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloved hands of the figure have only three fingers an thumb. Shermin takes Bell's flashlight. He angles it at the  faceplate. As he leans in to follow the beam, the pitch o the drill rises. He shifts the light. The drill breaks th and the faceplate explodes out of the helmet. The men thr themselves back in panic. When they turn back to look,  distorted impressions of the face inside the helmet refle on the glass of their contamination hoods. (Pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward the  body) We better get it into the box. Come  on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men approach the body but before they can bend it a burst of percussive language, followed by a low buzz comes from inside the extraterrestrial's helmet. The men  freeze. There is another burst of percussive language and projection beam shoots out of the helmet throwing the ima of the escaped STAR MAN onto one of the scientists. He ju aside and the beam falls out of focus and indistinct on t tent wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) The other one is alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is standing. We hear the sounds of his percu language coming from behind his mirrored faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitle) Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His answer is nothing but the low buzz. He taps a series buttons on his chest panel and speaks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again the buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mapmaker Wind. Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzz continues. He is very still for a moment. Then h presses the palms of his hands together, prayer fashion, concentrates. When he pulls them apart, a blue force fiel pulses between them. He stops at shoulder width. A solari aerial view of the United States forms on the force field green dot appears in the area of western Wisconsin, a red dot in the area of Death Valley, California. He drops his hands to his lap and sits very still. The solarized compa remains floating in the air in front of him. After a long moment he reaches up and squeezes it into a ball that  disappears when his palms come together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin steps through the open bay door into a communicat room. The radar and radio consoles each have a TECHNICIAN third technician, LYMAN, sits in front of a square of six medium-sized television screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it for real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyman taps a code into the computer keyboard. There's a s of static on one of the TV screens. When it clears up GEO FOX, mid-forties, hair slicked straight back, round wire- rimmed glasses, is peering intently into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before Fox can speak) It's real, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no mistake? You're absolutely  sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it with my own eyes. We've  killed an extraterrestrial and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any possibility that it's a  hoax? Could you be mistaken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None. And there's another one in the  area that's alive. I don't know if  it's the only one. I don't know if  it was left here by accident or it's  part of an inva...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the body out of there. Load it  on the Air Force chopper and get it  to Wright Patterson. They'll take it  from there... We didn't expect this,  Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering the  accusation) Neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Bell enters the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going... Damn! (he shakes his head  in disbelief) We'll tell the press that there was  an accident. Chemical warfare spill.  That cover cannot be violated in any  way. Understand me, Shermin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Bell here, sir. We have to  tell these people that we're friendly.  That this whole thing was a mistake.  Is anyone trying to contact the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores this) Shermin, I want you and Bell to start  looking for the one on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll need a lot of help, George.  You could hide an army up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the White House right  now. I'll try and get you everything  you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait... What are my orders if  we find this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox sits silently for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contain it and get back to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by 'contain?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox knows Shermin is looking for a definite order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television screen is reduced to static. Shermin stare at it blankly then Lyman turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift off of Shermin's helicopter reveals contaminatio suited scientists slipping the dead extraterrestrial's co into the Air Force helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN, still in his life-support suit, looks surre in the twilight world under the canopy of firs. The morni rain has gone. A hum of traffic pulls him across the hill a stand of alders that border the forest. Through the lea he can see a highway entering the sprawl of Eau Claire,  Wisconsin. The cars and trucks zipping along the asphalt of particular interest to him. When he has absorbed them he walks through the trees to g a better look at the town. On the wind he can hear shouts from students boarding a line of yellow buses in front of grade school off to his right. Suburban houses have begun snuggle up to the base of the hill he is on. Keeping to the tree line well above them he continues his search for an avenue of escape. His head swivels to watch Volvo station wagon come down the street. It swings into driveway of the house directly below him and stops next t Mustang Hatchback. The back door opens and JENNY HAYDN, a pretty girl in her mid-twenties, gets out carrying a crud lettered be-ribboned sign 'Welcome Back, Mrs. Haydn.' Fem voices drift up to the STAR MAN from inside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great to have you back... The  kids loved it. We loved it. You're  doing the right thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so... We'll see... See you  tomorrow... Bye. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the Volvo backs  out of the driveway) Remember you're required to have a  lesson planned tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny laughs and waves. With the Volvo moving away up the street Jenny picks her newspaper off her walk and goes in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN presses on through the trees. He hears a lig plane overhead. He stops and watches until the branches c off his view. A path between two logs leads him to the ti of a promontory. From behind the cedars growing there, he sits and looks down on the center of Eau Claire. Arm in arm, a YOUNG COUPLE meander through the trees. The boy has a blanket over his shoulder and the girl's hair i disheveled. Without seeing him, they walk past the STAR M crouched in a thicket of small pines. After they've gone he straightens up and watches them walk down toward the  highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is setting over suburban Eau Claire. The colors a reflected in the STAR MAN's faceplate as he watches Jenny push a hand mower over her back yard. He takes a dusty gray marble out of a leg pocket and whil Jenny finishes the lawn he rolls it between his gloves. I turns a glowing gold as it grows in size. When it reaches the dimensions of a baseball, he brings it close to his  faceplate and speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Iron channel message. Suit and rockets  destroyed. Radical mixture of this  atmosphere and ours in helmet allowed  chemo-ion response time to adapt my  body to this air. Am going to attempt  extreme transformation in order to  cross land mass to site of our  practice landings. If transformation  is not fatal, second message ball by  next darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his hands and the ball rises quickly into the sk Jenny is dumping the grass clippings into a garbage can a the side of the house when the sudden motion of the messa ball catches her eye and she watches it quizzically until disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on the belly of Shermin's helicopter looking at th tree tops rushing underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin is standing back of Lyman and Bell who are seated front of the square of television screens watching variou shots of the wooded landscape flowing by under them. Sher scrubs his hands over his face then bends over to stretch his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aghh... I'm supposed to umpire a  little league game tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about it... There  might not be any little league  tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you they're probably  friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did they try and sneak in  the back door? Tell me that. Why  didn't they contact us first and  say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) UFO coming out of the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyman and the technicians tap out orders to their trackin units and the views of the forest on three of the televis screens change to images from their microwave scanners,  neutron back scatters and doppler radar. On a fourth scre the forward-looking infrared module begins creating a pic of the UFO. The men relax as they recognize the configura of a light sea plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. What were we going to  do if that had been the ship? We  have two thirty calibre machine guns,  three M16's and some handguns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it a rest, Lyman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) I've never once heard of anybody  being hurt by an extraterrestrial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin goes hand over hand along the overhead straps to radio operator. He begins to flip through a stack of tele messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because the ones that were  hurt, died. They couldn't talk to  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to technician, after  a look at Lyman) Any reports about monsters, people  in Halloween masks, anything like  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but there sure were a lot of  people who saw lights in the sky  last night. Reports are still coming  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under above) I've heard of blood being drawn,  sometimes they were taken for a ride  in the ship, a lot of times they  said they had sex... But nobody was  ever hurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you decided those weren't real.  This one is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a buzz and a red dot appears in the center of on of the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder to  Shermin) Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps a three digit code and Fox comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photograph of a very thin slab of yellow plastic pops u on a second screen next to Fox. Above lines of glowing co dots are symbols of a hydrogen atom, pulsars, a nude man a woman and Earth's position in our solar system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognize this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a copy of the plaque NASA sent  into space on the Pioneer probes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Houston found it in the  extraterrestrial's suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have picked it up in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's not an accident that they  found us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't think that's necessarily  bad. At least it's a point of contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily bad! If they knew we  were here why didn't they let us  know they were coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get those answers when you  find the one you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to happen, George,  unless you get us the help you  promised us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been back and forth on this  all day and keeping in mind the panic  that would occur if this got to the  general public, it's been decided  not to expand the search at this  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let them do it this way, George.  It's too important. We can't find  this thing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to. We're trying to contact  the ship. If we do, I'll let you  know immediately. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television screen is reduced to static. Lyman shuts i off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the feeling we're expendable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We always were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking through the living room window at Jenny  watching television while she irons the clothes she plans wear to work tomorrow. The STAR MAN stands just outside t light-fall in the back yard watching her. A commercial interrupts the old movie with a jolly fat MA in a jumpsuit touting his used cars. The two words 'We  have...' are repeated constantly during the pitch. 'We ha automatics... We have sticks... We have colors... We have financing...' ... We move in close on the STAR MAN'S faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (practicing the human  sound) Wehave... (more precise) Wehave... (well-formed) Wehave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny finishes the skirt, unplugs the iron, picks up the  clothes, shuts off the television, the light and heads  upstairs. Half way up she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint through the  glass) Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around and looks down indecisively, then hurrie upstairs. A light goes on in the bedroom. The STAR MAN ba away to look up at it. He can't see anything. He is on hi way to try and get in the side door when Jenny comes clum down the stairs in an old sweatshirt and pulling on a pai of jeans. She disappears into the kitchen. Without warnin the door ahead of him is swung open and Jenny rushes out. The STAR MAN barely has time to step into the shadows. Je grabs the handle of one of the garbage cans lined against the house and drags it down to the street. When she comes back for the second one we see that the STAR MAN is no lo in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny comes in and locks the door. She passes through the kitchen and is on her way to the stairs when the STAR MAN steps out of the darkness in the living room. A scream ca in Jenny's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (precise) Wehave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny bolts for the front door. At the end of the hallway her foot catches in a phone cord pulling the phone off an end table. The receiver is jarred out of its cradle. Jenn regains her balance and gets to the door ahead of the STA MAN. She jerks it open, but the guard chain stops it thre inches from the jamb. Frantically, she tries again but th chain holds. The STAR MAN slams the door shut and reaches out to grab  her. She flails back at him. One of her hands strikes the panel on his chest and the identification light comes on  inside his helmet. At the sight of the STAR MAN, Jenny be to scream. He presses her back against the wall and puts mittened hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wehave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny ceases her struggle and begins to cry. The STAR MAN takes his hand away from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't hurt me... please...  please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding her with his eyes he grasps one of Jenny's hands lifts it up to look at it. He raises a piece of skin off her wrist, rolls it between his thumb and forefinger. Jenny lets out a blood-curdling scream and strikes out at him. Flashes of light erupt off his exposed chest where s hits. The ferocity of her attack knocks him aside and she sprints up the stairs. The STAR MAN recovers and starts after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny gets there two steps ahead of the STAR MAN. She sla the door in his face and locks it. With him POUNDING ON T OUTSIDE, Jenny throws open the closet and begins rummagin madly through the side pockets of her jackets and coats. The POUNDING STOPS. It takes her a moment to hear the sil When she does, she whirls toward the door expecting the w but it remains closed. She waits. All she can hear is the sound of the rain. She intensifies her search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysteria creeping  into her voice) It's got to be here... it's got to  be here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds it in the pocket of a down jacket. The Army iss .45 looks big in her hand. She releases the safety and, w a wary eye on the door, reaches for the phone on the nigh table next to the bed. Long before the receiver gets to her ear, she can hear th "BLEET" caused by the PHONE BEING OFF THE HOOK for so lon in the living room. She hangs up and walks around the bed sit on the corner facing the door. In the distance, we ca HEAR the THUMP OF AN APPROACHING HELICOPTER. After a mome indecision, Jenny gets up and releases the lock. Again sh waits. Nothing happens. With the gun ready, she turns the knob a opens the door a crack. The hallway is empty. She kicks o her shoes and lets herself out of the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny creeps toward the stairs in her stockinged feet. Sh looks in the bathroom. The STAR MAN isn't there. She deci to go downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN isn't in the living room. Jenny sidles along the wall for the front door. At the archway to the den a  hissing sound stops her. She peers around the molding. Th spill from the stairwell light provides the only illumina The STAR MAN is sitting on the edge of a chair with his b to her. He is naked. A dot of light is HISSING around his head. The shadows in the room make it difficult for Jenny tell exactly what is going on. Pointing the .45 at the STAR MAN, she steps into the room for a better look. The floor creaks and the STAR MAN turn to her. Jenny shudders at what she sees. The STAR MAN is  holding an 8x10 color photograph of Jenny and a man in hi mid-twenties standing on a beach in their bathing suits. The dot of light is copying the man's features onto the S MAN'S translucent head. The top two-thirds of the face is already done. Everything is perfect, even the eyes. Jenny begins to tremble and lowers the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a small voice) No... please don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sags against the armchair, racked by sobs that are dr out by the FLAP OF THE APPROACHING HELICOPTER. The STAR M with the dot of light stopped on his left cheek, gets up takes the gun from her. He drops it on the couch and raises his eyes to the sound the helicopter NOW DIRECTLY OVER THE HOUSE. THROUGH THE  WINDOWS, we can SEE the searchlight scouring the hillside next to the back yard. The STAR MAN returns to the picture and resumes his  transformation. He completes the chin, then continues dow weaving skin and filling in the human characteristics ove the entire body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come down an electrical cord that ends in a micro-phon then down further to DR. BERGEN, a tall thin balding man his late fifties dressed in the medical equivalent of a  contamination suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature was hit three times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a laser light indicator Dr. Bergen shows us where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the arm, the abdomen and the upper  chest, the one in the chest being  the cause of death. It shattered,  for want of a better term, the  creature's backbone. It's not really,  because it's not jointed. It's simply  a hollow shaft of very pliable  silicate material, as is its entire  endoskeleton. The creature seems to  have tremendous regenerative powers.  Although it must have died within  minutes of receiving the fatal wound,  the arm and abdomen wounds are almost  totally healed and the bullet here... (indicates with the  light) has begun to dissolve...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox, another CIVILIAN and two MEN in uniform are watching the autopsy on a bank of screens which show Dr. Bergen, t room and various close-ups of the dead extraterrestrial l on a white glass table lit from underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has veins but no blood. We think,  and this is just speculation, that  some form of energy flows from the  brain, which is much more  sophisticated than ours, throughout  the rest of the body... We don't  think there is any danger of bacterial  contamination. Our biochemistries  are too different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin and his crew are glued to the monitors, watching autopsy from Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flesh is gelatinous, the skin is  very porous and very moist. This is  another guess, but it probably comes  from a planet that receives only  reflected light, perhaps from a ring  of moons. Its atmospheric pressure  is slightly less than ours and it  contains a great deal more water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Bergen, George Fox here in  Washington. Can you give us an idea  of why they're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're so advanced... I... eh...  can't imagine what they would want  from us. I know they could be  dangerous. But they could also be  the greatest thing that ever happened  to mankind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin and his crew share mixed reactions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, sitting on the floor with her arms wrapped around knees, is reflected in a mirror fastened to the back of t closet door. The STAR MAN edges around the door to look a himself in the glass. In baggy tan cords, a windbreaker a a plaid shirt, buttoned all the way to the neck and a but in the wrong hole halfway down the front, he looks like a innocent abroad. He notices the shirt is askew across his chest and, with his new hands, awkwardly resets the butto He looks himself over. His movements resemble a human's b are noticeably more precise. The clothes seem right so he leans into the mirror to ins his face. He squeezes the skin on his cheeks, examines hi eyes, turns his head as far as he can to inspect the side of his face, folds his ears forward to check the skin beh them and he even gives a good two-fisted tug to his hair see if it is on securely. He turns from the mirror and goes over to where the .45 a a leg pouch from his life-support suit are lying on the b next to a snapshot of the man whose identity he has taken In the picture the man is dressed exactly as the STAR MAN now. The STAR MAN picks up the gun and the pouch and, spe to Jenny in his own language, steps to the door and motio for her to follow. Jenny consciously ignores him. The STA MAN comes over, reaches down and grabs her arm to pull he to her feet. Jenny squirms back, but he holds her tight. looks at the hand, almost touches it, then up at the fami yet disturbingly unfamiliar face above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... don't do this... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN gets her to her feet and hustles her out of room. On the dresser is Jenny's wedding picture. The man STAR MAN has become is her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN pulls Jenny down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggles to free  herself) You're hurting me. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN guides her into the entryway and reaches for the front door. Realizing his intentions, Jenny increases her struggle and manages to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, no! I'm not leaving this  house with you. You're going to hurt  me, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks intently at her, then opens the front  door. He taps his chest, points to Jenny and motions to t dawn outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through tears) I can't. I'd like to help. You look  like Scott, but I know you're not. I  don't know what you are. You gotta  understand, I'm afraid of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jenny backs into the living room, the STAR MAN closes door. He raises the gun, examines it quickly, then with h finger around the trigger, points it at Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to me? I'll  give you whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN swings the muzzle sights across Jenny's body and FIRES. A FLOOR VASE EXPLODES. Jenny turns to look at remains, then back to the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang is backing out of the driveway with Jenny beh the wheel and the STAR MAN perched nervously on the passe seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wary of what will happen next, the STAR MAN watches Jenny move the gear selector to the drive position. The car jerks forward and he grabs the dashboard to keep  from toppling back in the seat. During the ride up the block, his head swivels from side side trying to take in as much of the darkened urban land as he can. When the car stops at a 'stop' sign, he looks Jenny questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way do you want to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions ahead and he turns to look at an inter-sectio with streets running in three directions off of it. His e question Jenny again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go that way... (points left) That way... (straight ahead) That way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points right. After another look at Jenny, the STAR M presses the palms of his hands together, concentrates bri then slowly draws them apart. The force field appears bet them. On it the solarized view of the United States rotat until the red destination dot is on his right. He drops h hands and points to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (measured) That way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The satel compass continues to hover over the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring incredulously  at the compass) God, what are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts her right turn without looking left and fails see a little MG approaching from that direction. The WAIL THE AIR HORN startles Jenny and reflexively she slams on brakes. The Mustang stalls and the MG squeals around them. Jenny  checks the STAR MAN. He has pressed himself against the  passenger door. The gun lies on the seat next to him. The both look at it. The STAR MAN recovers and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting the engine) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time when Jenny puts the car into drive, the STAR MA is ready for the acceleration. The car completes the turn and the compass rotates to its new heading. Looking at it from this angle, Jenny suddenly recognizes it for what it is: an aerial view of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That green dot, that's us, isn't  it... and the red's where you want  to go?... You don't understand me,  do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks at her uncomprehendingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) I gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang cruises through the industrial section of Eau Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is watching Jenny drive. A set of headlights rushes TOWARD US in the other lane. Jenny twists around t follow the car as it goes by and we SEE the desperation o her face. When she returns her attention to the road, she sneaks a  glance at the STAR MAN to see if her action has given awa her state of mind. His expression hasn't changed. Jenny t a deep breath and lets it out slowly. Uttering a phrase i his own language, the STAR MAN touches the steering wheel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking the steering  wheel is called  'what," he repeats) What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the same phrase in his language, he points to the 'g shift.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing her mistake) Ah... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeats) Ah no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the dashboard. Jenny senses there is going t be a great deal of misunderstanding if she uses more word She shakes her head 'no' and touches the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enunciates) Steering wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting her) What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny shakes her head 'no.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeats) Steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the gear  shift) Gear shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gear shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps the dashboard) Dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sees a police car creeping across the intersection  ahead of her and interrupts the lesson to stare at it. Th STAR MAN looks to where she is looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh... police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering) Police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the gun off his lap. Jenny tries to distract hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raps on the steering  wheel) What?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his eyes on the police car the STAR MAN ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steering wheel... (she points to the  gear shift) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is intent on the police car. Jenny gives up  trying to distract him. The patrol car passes out of thei view. The STAR MAN lowers the gun and looks at Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unprompted, points  correctly at each  item) Steering wheel... gear shift...  dashboard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this frightens Jenny  even more) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We COME DOWN FROM a red light TO FIND the Mustang stopped behind the limit line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light changes and the car proceeds straight across th intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the STAR MAN picks through the contents of the glov compartment, Jenny looks for a way to escape. An all-nigh laundromat is a possibility, but it's deserted. The STAR finds the switch on a flash-light and flicks it on and of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant) Flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the flashlight in his lap along with the owner's  manual and gas slips and takes a stack of Discount Coupon out of the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coupons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sees a set of headlights turn into the oncoming lan She slides her eyes toward the STAR MAN. He is busy looki through the Coupons. Jenny measures the distance between Mustang and the oncoming lights. The STAR MAN holds up on of the Coupons and points to a picture of the product.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curt) Pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the cluster of letters that spells SAVE 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny doesn't answer. The distance between the two vehicl is narrowing rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sets her jaw and wrenches the steering wheel violen to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang skids sideways across the center line. The  oncoming van jams on its brakes and swerves to its left.  Locked in a skid, it drifts toward the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN sucks himself back in terror as the van desc on him. It swings past his window and clips the rear fend of the Mustang. Both vehicles shudder to a stop. Jenny cl at her door. It swings open. She is halfway out before th STAR MAN manages to grab the tail of her sweatshirt. Jenn begins to scream at the top of her lungs and keeps it up  while he tries to wrestle her down on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall, raw-boned MAN in his late twenties storms around front of his van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid son of a bitch!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Help me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have killed us both!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (battling to maintain  her grip on the door  frame) He's kidnapping me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man bends down to look at the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!! You crazy people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the police!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sure he wants to  get involved) Hey buddy... let her go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN increases his efforts and Jenny loses her gr on one of the door frames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her other  arm) Hey, she doesn't want to go with  you. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN frees his right hand and blindly searches th floor for the gun. He comes up with it and, shoving the b in the Man's face, barks a harsh command in his language. The Man freezes and Jenny stops struggling. It's suddenly very quiet on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, man... don't shoot me... My  mistake... I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't understand... just walk  away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN claps a hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise I'm not going to tell  anybody about this... None of my  business... I'm going to move now,  okay... (takes a step to one  side) You guys want to fight, that's up to  you... (takes another step) I'm leaving now... I won't say a  word...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps his eyes on the STAR MAN until he reaches the ba of the Mustang, steals a quick look at the license plate, then blots for his van. The STAR MAN takes his hand off  Jenny's mouth and slams her back into her seat. Uttering expletive in his language he points the gun in her face a keeping it there indicates the red dot on the satel compa floating undisturbed above the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang moves back into the correct lane and continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you put the gun down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN just stares at her. She points to the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun... Down... Down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, he lowers it to his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's helicopter is taking on fuel from an Army tanke truck. The pilot and co-pilot are catching forty winks on the grass next to the old bunkhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Bell, bleary-eyed and unshaven, is huddled in front the television screens eating a breakfast off a styrofoam plate. On the top left screen is a satellite picture of  Northern Michigan and half of Wisconsin taken with a Dopp radar. On the lower left screen is an infrared view of the same  area. Over both these views is a schematic of the state  boundaries and major cities. On the screens to the right these views are blow-ups of smaller sections of the overv Lyman and the radar technician are asleep on the floor. S in front of the radio console Shermin is going through th telex messages. Next to him the radio technician is bent  over the desk with his head in his forearms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing... No reports of  sightings or landings or anything...  in the other parts of the country or  overseas... Seems like a totally  isolated incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was only an accident that we  discovered them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin continues on through the messages. Bell asks the  computer to change the pictures on the screens. Rhythmica a sequence of images appears and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You married, Major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-eight years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the same woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried it once... Fourteen years  ago... 'I was a lousy husband and a  worse father. The only thing I'm  good at is this... At least until  yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell stuffs his breakfast plate into a garbage bag and go to get a breath of fresh air in the open doorway. Shermin stops at a point on the telex sheet. He reads the message himself again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you describe the sounds we  heard coming out of that thing's  helmet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after trying to  imitate them) It was kind of like clicking, maybe  a language wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to this. (paraphrasing the  telex) A woman was kidnapped in Eau Claire  this morning. When a citizen went to  her rescue the kidnapper threatened  him with a gun and shouted at him in  a strange 'clicking gibberish'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a man though... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police think he was high on  drugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a rush the helicopter rises out of the trees and thu away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are Eau Claire police cars on the street. Shermin i out back watching Bell pick his way down the hill. Throug the windows we see uniformed policemen in the living room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slides the last few  feet down the hill) Nothing up there... The grass is  matted down in a few places, but  that could have been anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the husband. The police finally  got a hold of the witness at work  and showed him a picture of the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man standing next to her in the picture was her husba and the witness said that was the guy who kidnapped her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the right area, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout the above, Shermin has noticed a WOMAN in the  house next door peeping through her blinds at the activit around Jenny's. She closes the drapes suddenly when she  realizes Shermin has spotted her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the clicking language though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin knocks and waits on the steps with Bell for someo to answer. We hear a chain being pulled off and the door opened by a freckled-face MAN in his late thirties, dress in a business suit and wiping the traces of a breakfast f around his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disturb you, sir, but there's  been some trouble next door. I'd  like to ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a possibility that Mrs.  Haydn's been kidnapped. We're hoping  you might have seen something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN in a robe opens the door a little wider to includ herself in the conversation. She is as freckled as the ma and about the same age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Man) I told you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, that's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe these men won't think  so. We were asleep when a helicopter  woke me up. It made me so nervous I  went into the kitchen for something  to eat. I happened to look out the  window and there was Scott Haydn  with this green thing draped over  his arm pulling Jenny down the walk  to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I saw. I've seen him  enough times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving up on his  wife and addressing  Shermin and Lyman) Scott Haydn is dead. He died about  three months ago. We went to the  funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin and Bell exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's Mustang is sailing through the beautiful Wisconsi farmland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-r-S-s...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is copying the letters, upper and lower case from the Owner's Manual he found in the glove compartment onto the back of an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws the upper case but has to check the manual for t lower case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks up as they go by a farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing correctly  to the various animals) Cow... Dog... Pig...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Jenny for confirmation. She nods absently. He returns to the alphabet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forms both the upper and lower case 'X-x' and shows th to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows what's coming) X...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without smiling the STAR MAN opens his mouth and emits a  short chirping laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny about X?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN laughs harder. Jenny watches him warily. He  starts to hiccup. He is unable to control it through the  laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's image waits on the television screen. He is gau tired and visibly shaken. The picture sizzles and breaks intermittently. Fox and the three men who watched the aut stride quickly into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice quavering) George, we've just confirmed the  existence of the live  extraterrestrial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) When can we expect containment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're in pursuit of a green  Mustang...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very controlled) It's in a green Mustang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's kidnapped a woman at  gunpoint and from what we can make  out is forcing her to drive it  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the room) This one has a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... A .45, it probably got it  in the woman's house. They were last  seen in downtown Eau Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you let it get into a  populated area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken on a disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarify that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's made itself look like the woman's  dead husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static breaks up the t.v. picture. When it returns, Fox l toward the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat the last item.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost reluctantly Shermin holds up Scott Haydn's picture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The extraterrestrial now looks like  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh shit!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's Mustang moves along through the traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are CLOSE ON the back of a ten-dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading slowly) The United States of America. In God  We Trust. Ten dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back as he holds the ten up to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, the STAR MAN puts the money back into Jenny's w and reads the first card through its plastic window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mi-chi-gan driver li-see-ens...  Jennyhaydn... Money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head  'no,' exhausted) We're going to have to stop for gas  soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the license is a picture of Jenny smiling broadly. STAR MAN looks at Jenny, back at the picture, then imitat the smile for Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile... good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He practices curling the corners of his mouth up into a s One of them freezes as the Interstate curves and a gliste skyline backlit by the afternoon sun comes into view acro a river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minneapolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching into the  leg pouch he took  from his life-support  suit) Minneapolis... Minneapolis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points the white disc at Minneapolis. With a 'POP,' a  cone of light flashes out. It sucks back, almost instantl bringing with it a three-dimensional image of the skyline

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minneapolis... good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of tricks, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car starts across the twin cities' bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps the fuel gauge) We need gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks at the gauge. Jenny scrunches against door to avoid contact with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This car runs on gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses the accelerator to the floor. The car jumps  forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her foot off the accelerator and the car quickl slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang spurts forward a few yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It staggers down to a crawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car leaps forward again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It drops back to a crawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas... car dead. (her head lolls forward  on her chest) We need gas. I don't want to get  shot for running out of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are LOOKING DOWN Jenny's arm AT a gas station just off Interstate 169 in the Minneapolis suburbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN contemplates the station as they pass it, th turns to Jenny, puzzled:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's closed... closed. We need one  that's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no more gas stations in sight. The STAR MAN bec bored with the silence. He picks up Jenny's wallet. The  driver's license is familiar so he flips to the next wind In it is a picture of an older man and woman standing in  front of a church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Not what. Who. What is for things. (touching the steering  wheel, dashboard,  seat, gear shift) What? What? What? What? For people  you use who. Who is he? (points to the man in  the picture) Who is she? (points to the woman) Who are you? (points to the STAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mirrors her gestures) Who is he? Who is she? Who are you?  Who am I? (pause; it clicks for  him and he points at  Jenny) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Jenny Haydn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flips back to her  license and reads) Jennyhaydn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR MODULATED CLICKS of his percussive LANGUAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big help. Where are you  from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans forward and  points through the  windshield at the  sky) Are you from up there? Space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans forward to  look with her) Space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there... I... eh... can't  explain... (leans back) But that's the only place you could  be from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN spots a station on the other side of the  Interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head 'no') Closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps the fuel gauge which has dipped below empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both scan the horizon for a gas station. When one do come up immediately, the STAR MAN flips to the next pictu in the wallet. It is of the man he has become. He is lean against a fire truck, in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't know what you are, but  you're not Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The STAR MAN catches her mood. A tear rolls down Jenny's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brushes it away  angrily) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... don't say that. Bad word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (likes the sound of  it) Shit... shit... what shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Stop!! Enough!! Jesus! You're worse  than a parrot!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like closing a zipper, she slides her fingers across her  mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouth closed... closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN does as he is told. He doesn't like it, but does it. With his lips puckered, he looks straight down t road. The car rises out of a gulley. Topping a knoll stra ahead is a gas station with an enormous Exxon sign revolv above it. With his lips firmly pressed together, he tugs  Jenny's sleeve and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN reaches forward and squeezes the satel compa back into his palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang comes up the off-ramp toward the pumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN'S hand closes around the butt of the .45 whe he sees the ATTENDANT step out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attendant. He'll give us gas. Put  the gun down. Under the seat. Under  the seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God! You're going to get us both  killed. Okay... in your pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves her hand into the pocket of her slacks showing him what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your pocket... pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny eases in next to the pumps and stops. The Attendant already coming around the front of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your pocket, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draws his fingers  over his lips) You. Mouth closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN stuffs the gun into the left pocket of his b cords just as the Attendant arrives at the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, folks. Fill her up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks at Jenny for help. She sweeps her fing across her mouth to indicate her lips are sealed. The STA MAN peeks around her at the Attendant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly loud) ...Gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the window. The STAR MAN watches him until the  nozzle is in the Mustang, then pleased with himself, turn to Jenny and lifts his face into a 'smile.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the ladies' room. You  stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny gets out of the car. When she straightens up, she f the STAR MAN staring at her over the roof. She slams the  door and strides rapidly in the direction of the ladies'  room. Stuffing the green pouch in his pocket, the STAR MA trots after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheels on him as he  catches up) Go back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks at her but doesn't move. Jenny snarls frustration, then with the STAR MAN on her heels, stalks the ladies' room and throws open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN follows Jenny inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. It's a bathroom. I'm not trying  to escape. I just have to go to the  bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks out the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied? Now get out. Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.
