dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Jenny steps around him and opens the door. She p to the sign on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women... me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues out. The STAR MAN goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny points to the sign on the next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men. You go in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cracks the door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the door from her and pushes it open for a look  inside. Jenny ducks into the ladies' room. He is confused for a moment then takes a long look at the men's room. It means nothing to him. He backs out and tries the ladies'  room. It is locked. Not knowing what to do, the STAR MAN  stands uncomfortably in front of the door, then like a ch waiting for his mother, he sits on the curb. He watches t Attendant lift the Mustang's hood and reach in for the  dipstick. The numbers on the pumps turn over, adding up t gallons and the cost of the gas. Everything is peaceful and quiet within the circle of lig cast by the gas station. The STAR MAN pulls the camera di out of his pocket and points it at the pumps. The cone of light flashes out and pulls back its three-dimensional im The Attendant turns around and waves genially at the STAR MAN, who waves back a perfect imitation of the gesture. The SHARP RUMBLE of a SOUPED-UP HONDA MOTORCYCLE coming u the off-ramp shatters the mood and the STAR MAN gets to h feet. He is startled by the image of the RIDER. In a one piece  driving skin and helmet he looks amazingly like a space  traveller. The STAR MAN steps cautiously forward for a be look and mutters something to himself in his language. Th rider stops his bike at the second row of pumps and swing himself stiffly out of the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I need a key for the head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without taking off his helmet, the Rider sets out for the men's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Fill it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rider's approach frightens the STAR MAN. He backs up the ladies' room door and knocks. There is no answer. He  tries the knob. With the other hand he inches the gun sli out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is bent over the sink dabbing nail polish around th corners of a paper towel. Her head snaps around to look a the doorknob. It holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN tenses and forces a smile as the Rider passe in front of him. A VOICE comes from behind the faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy... can't get her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru the smile) Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how she feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rider enters the men's room. As the door closes behin him, the STAR MAN's face falls and he knocks frantically the ladies' room door. Jenny opens it under his knuckles. blocks the doorway and she backs up as he steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks around. Jenny's eyes widen at what is  happening behind him. The pneumatic arm above the door is pulling it shut to reveal her paper towel pasted to the b The message on it, written in red lipstick, reads: KIDNAP GOING W ON 169 JADE MUS. LIC#PXV237.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping around him) It's still a toilet. Hasn't become a  ballroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to swing the door open and hide her message aga the wall, but she is too slow. The STAR MAN sees it and s forward to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid-nap-ped... go-ing W o-n...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny realizes he doesn't know what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on her way out) That's very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other graffiti on the door helps convince the STAR MAN Je message has nothing to do with him and after a last look it, he follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAN of Coke CLATTERS DOWN the chute of a drink dispense Jenny picks it up and, with the STAR MAN hovering at her  shoulder, moves on to the candy machine. He watches a qua disappear into the slot and when Jenny picks another one of her purse, he points to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She inserts the quarter and makes her selection. A Reese' Peanut Butter Cup drops from its position into the pickup bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the change from this and another quarter, she selec an Almond Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as it tumbles into  the bin) Money... candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the STAR MAN) That'll be fifteen fifty, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to make change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny pops the top on the Coke can and on the way to the takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is... (reads off the can) ...Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds his hand out  for it) I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to try it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stuff could kill... (changes her mind and  smiles) Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN fills his mouth, swirls it around and swallo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a loud burp) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the can back to Jenny. She looks at it and knows there are alien bacteria there her body would not like to meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh... you keep it. I've had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN takes another drink. He stops dead when he l the can. Jenny continues for a few steps before she reali he isn't with her. She looks back over her shoulder. Her  eyes go immediately to where he is looking. The license p PXV 237 hangs like an accusation on the front bumper of t Mustang. Jenny decides to brazen it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throws the can to  the ground) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and the STAR MAN ride along in tight-lipped silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is kidnapped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells) Kidnapped!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flinches but remains silent. The STAR MAN snatches th paper towel off his lap and flaps it in her face, jabbing the word violently with a forefinger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnapped!!! What is kidnapped?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny can't take it anymore and screams back at him throu tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidnapped is what you're doing to me  now!!! Kidnapped is pointing a gun  at me and taking me from my house!  Kidnapped is changing yourself into  my husband. I don't know what you  are and I don't care. I just want to  get away from you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's outburst rocks the STAR MAN back into silence. He waits for her to calm down, then slowly takes the gun out his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhaydn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't dare look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am good. (and he slides the  .45 under his seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny speeds up to pass a truckload of horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer. The car passes the truck. The highway before them is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at  her) Horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny TURNS ON the RADIO and finds a COUNTRY AND WESTERN  STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is pleasing to him and he listens for a while, then re in his pouch and takes out one of the dusty gray marbles. rolls it between his palms. It changes to a glowing gold it grows to the size of a baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN brings the globe close to his mouth and spea into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Iron channel message. Transmute was  successful. Have captured one of  them. It is taking me to the pick-up  point in a land vehicle. (eyeing Jenny) I think I can control it by mastering  its language, which is primitive and  easy to learn. Will arrive on time.  Wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN opens his hands and, to Jenny's astonishment the ball rises quickly and seeps through her roof without leaving a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang swerves violently, then straightens itself as the ball comes through the roof and surges into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unexpectedly, Shermin's helicopter storms into view. It i so close we can count the rivets. As it clears, we go to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flow of traffic on the Interstate below is being fed  into the six television screens from infrared cameras on belly of the craft. The image on the screen under the mas begins to move and ends in a close-up of a green Mustang. It's not Jenny's. With a buzz the red dot appears and Fox face interrupts the view of the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came from a meeting with the  Security Council and (the picture breaks  up, but the voice  continues) in view of the extraterrestrial's  radical change and the fact that all  our efforts (the picture re- assembles) to contact its ship remain unanswered,  it was decided to issue a ten state  'all points bulletin' for Scott Haydn,  Jenny Haydn and the green Mustang.  The officers have been instructed  not to approach the people or the  vehicle but to contact you. You will  then move in and contain the subjects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin rubs his hands over his face while he digests thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sorting it out) You sure you want this, because...  that's putting an awful lot of faith  in people we have no control over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid the situation demands  that kind of risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it, George...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit Shermin. Earlier you were  asking for help. What's changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's messy... the thing's got a gun...  We're just asking for somebody to  get killed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know what else to do. We  need results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accepting) You'll get results one way or the  other, that's for sure... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be here if you need  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His image is replaced by one of the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna let some local cop  blow him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save us all a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Lyman, you're an ignorant fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no conception of this, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jerk! You look at all the  sweetness and light and goodness you  think'll come out of this. You know  what's gonna come out of this... The  end of religion, the end of  civilization, the end of the earth.  We could become slaves, we could  become a colony of these things.  Don't you see that? Are you too stupid  to see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ladies through?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell and Lyman look at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... It looks like we might be  the welcoming committee, so I think  we should try and figure out what  we're gonna do if we have to come  face to face with this creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bell wants us to get down on our  knees and bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bell) Did your people have any contingencies  rehearsed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I guess we never thought it  would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Shermin's turn to look at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one of the screens behind him the camera has picked up lighted billboard advertising 'Kellogg's Corn Flakes' wit its slogan 'HAVE A GREAT DAY.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's Mustang is barreling along well over the speed li As it PASSES US, we PAN WITH it TO a sign: SLOW FOR  INTERSECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truckload of corn is hurtling down ON US from the north An empty semi is rumbling up from the south. The light is their favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is driving. It is obvious that he doesn't se the red light facing him. But Jenny does. And she also se the trucks closing in from either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) Red light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN doesn't see it, doesn't believe her, doesn't slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Stop!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is as if all three vehicles have heard Jenny. They sla on their brakes at the same time and begin to skid toward each other. It's going to be close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prows of the trucks loom over Jenny and the STAR MAN  and, for a fleeting instant, it looks like they will join the bugs imbedded in the radiators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang barely squeaks through and the trucks slam in each other behind it, spilling corn all over the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It finally comes to a stop on the center line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a red light!! I told you  you have to stop at a red light!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish) It was yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't even see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks back for the traffic light. It is hang from a pole in the middle of the road. Under it the truck DRIVERS are climbing out of the cabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see it next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN angles back into his lane and begins to pick speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deftly, the STAR MAN moves in and out of the afternoon  traffic. A bus coming in the other direction hits a potho filled with water and the SPLASH covers the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny watches the STAR MAN calmly turn on the wipers and washer and clean the windshield. The light above the  intersection ahead turns red and, even though he is still fiddling with the wipers, the STAR MAN manages a smooth s back of the crosswalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the red  dot on the satel  compass) Why are you going here? What is here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... (searches for word) ...car will take me... (pokes finger toward  sky) ...up there... home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light changes and the STAR MAN continues down the str

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the red dot again) When do you have to be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs her temples and  laments to herself) How will I do this one?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer is hovering above the city in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the sun) Sun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun... day. No sun... night. You  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Day... night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many days and nights do you have  to go... (prods the red dot) ...here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three nights... two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not much time. I'll just slow  you down. I have to sleep. I'm very  tired. And I have to wash and eat.  You don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell anybody if that's what  you're worried about. I promise.  You'll keep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll keep the car. I'll take a  bus... (an awful possibility  occurs to her) Am I going up there with you... in  your ship... up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let me go. You don't need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm going crazy here.  You're Scott. But he's dead. I don't  know what's real anymore. I can't be  here with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is unyielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand what I'm saying to  you? You can keep the car. (she hands him some  money) That should be enough for gas from  here to there. Please let me go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taps the red dot on  the satel compass) When we get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny slams herself angrily back in the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her upper lip trembles and, in spite of herself, she migh cry. The STAR MAN sees the center lane is open. He checks his side mirror and drifts over, only to be caught by a l The car is still rolling when Jenny makes her move. She t open the door and, by the time the STAR MAN turns around, she is out and running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhaydn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his foot off the brake to go after her and the c lurches into the cross traffic. He clambers back behind t wheel, regains control and cuts a hard right in front of other car waiting at the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over her shoulder, Jenny can see the Mustang coming. She  dodges up a brick walkway toward a J.C. Penney shopping m The Mustang skids to a stop at the curb. The STAR MAN jum out in time to see Jenny push her way past a stream of  pedestrian traffic and enter the mall. He leaves the car zigzags through the people in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he barges in, the STAR MAN accidentally knocks a cup o Coke out of a YOUNG MAN's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a panic to find Jenny, he continues jostling past peop to look in the shops that border the atrium.

dialogues.speaker: MEZZANINE
dialogues.text: Jenny warily approaches the railing and peers over. Below her the STAR MAN comes out of a record store. She turns a and gets on the escalator to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN thinks he sees Jenny in an electronics store but when the girl turns around, it is obviously not her.  Backing out of there, he knocks over a sandwich board  advertising a restaurant. The LOUD THWACK it makes when i hits the cement turns faces in his direction. Jenny's is not among them. His eyes raise to the mezzanin Maybe she's there. He looks wildly around for a way up. H spots the escalator and, trying to keep the upper floor i view while he runs for it, he slams into an unattended pr It begins to tip over. The BABY INSIDE SCREAMS. The STAR manages to snatch it out of the carriage before it hits t floor. He is looking for a place to put it when the MOTHE comes charging out of a plant store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My baby!!! He's stealing my baby!  Burt!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN holds the baby out to her. She grabs it out of his hands and he turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt!! Somebody stop him!! He was  stealing my baby!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two tough-looking MEN in T-shirts step in to block the ST MAN's way to the escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not understanding, the STAR MAN tries to get by them. The push him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall, skinny blond man with spectacles elbows his way t the Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was trying to steal Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two steps and Burt is on the STAR MAN. He spins him aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws him back against the crowd that has gathered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stutters) Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt pulls the STAR MAN up by his shirt front and shakes  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right? Come on. Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear erases the STAR MAN's tenuous grasp of English and h begins to jabber in his own language. This makes Burt eve madder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you trying to steal my baby?  Huh? Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhaydn!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Jenny has just gotten on the escalator to the third floor when she hears her name. She knows she shouldn't but she  gets off and joins the crowd at the railing. From there, can see the STAR MAN trapped in a circle of people. He cl Burt away from him and tries to thrash his way out of the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhaydn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the T-shirts throws him back and Burt begins to pu him. We MOVE IN UNTIL we are CLOSE ON Jenny's face.

dialogues.speaker: GROUND FLOOR
dialogues.text: Some of the onlookers have joined Burt in his attempt to  bring the STAR MAN down. Growling in his own language, th STAR MAN fights back as best he can. The sleeve of his  windbreaker is torn. One of the T-shirts lands a blow on right shoulder that turns the STAR MAN around. He takes a blow on the chest. Another in the kidneys. Burt gets a gr on the STAR MAN's left wrist and holds on. The attackers  close in. Jenny's voice cuts through the din.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!!! Stop it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She barges into the fray and starts peeling the men away  from the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from him!! Leave him alone!!  You stupid jerks!! He's retarded!!  Can't you see that?!! Get away from  him!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men do. Jenny pushes the sleeve of the torn wind-brea back up on the STAR MAN's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was stealing my baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong!! He would never do  anything like that!! (takes STAR MAN's  hand) Let's go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had Gloria in his hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's retarded! I shouldn't have left  him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to push out of the circle. Burt steps in to bl her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses) Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him until he does, then leads the STAR MAN  down the path that opens for them in the crowd. They pass MALL GUARD who has just arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still shaken, the STAR MAN nods. Jenny realizes that it i comforting to him to have his hand in hers and she leads like a child down the sidewalk to the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Jenny puts him in  the passenger seat) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mall Guard follows them down the walk-way and watches them drive off. He scribbles the license number in his  notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the counter Jenny puts her Visa card back into her wal while the CLERK staples the pages of a ticket into a trav folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing it to her) Gate three. It's boarding now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Jenny THROUGH the people milling around the ben in the waiting area TO the STAR MAN seated in an open-fac coffee shop. He is watching a MOTHER feed her baby in the booth across from him. A map of the United States is spre out on the formica. Jenny plunks herself down catty-corne from him. The tear in his sleeve has been closed with saf pins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closest I was able to get you  was Lathrop Wells...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to baby) Is that a baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baby is a new person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh... yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... The closest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to have a baby. But I  can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... Forget the baby. Okay?  The closest I was able to get you  was Lathrop Wells. You'll have to  hitchhike the rest of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks at the map. Lathrop Wells is a small t north of Las Vegas on Highway 95. From there he runs his  finger to a spot in the Funeral Range of Death Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I must go here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that. But the buses don't go  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious) What is hitchhike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's easy. I'll explain that in a  minute. This is your ticket. When  you get on the bus here, the driver  will take this part. You will ride  to Omaha. When you get to Omaha, ask  the driver. 'Salt Lake City, please.  I do not speak English.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN nods that he understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Salt Lake City, please. I do not  speak English.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please do it my way? You'll  get into trouble if you don't. If  anybody talks to you, tell them... I  do not speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant) I do not speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. In Omaha the driver will put  you on the bus for Salt Lake City  and the new driver will take... (bends back second  portion of ticket) ...this part. When you get to Salt  Lake City, ask the driver, 'Las Vegas,  please'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) 'Las Vegas, please. I do not speak  English.' What is hitchhike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want this ticket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't be smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last call for bus 33 to Vermillion,  Sioux City and Omaha... loading at  Gate 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your bus. (picks up the map and  folds it) When you get to Las Vegas, ask the  driver. 'Lathrop Wells, please. I do  not speak English.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falling into step  next to her) 'Lathrop Wells, please. I do not  speak English.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him the map) You keep this. Now this is hitch- hike... (stops in the middle  of the waiting area  to illustrate) You stand on the side of the road,  the highway... you understand? And  you face the cars going in the  direction you want to go. When you  see a car or a truck coming, you  stick out your thumb like this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny takes a few sweeps at an imaginary highway with her thumb. The stares this pantomime draws make the STAR MAN  more nervous about the bus trip than he already is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your thumb tells the driver that you  want a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car will stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing toward  the loading platform) Not every car, but... a car will  stop... Maybe not the first car...  maybe number eight, number fifteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I get to Lathrop Wells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning. Start hitch-hiking  right away and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny pushes open a glass door to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you'll have plenty of time to get  to where you want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN hangs back when he sees the security guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. They're not going to  hurt you. Come on. (gives him ticket) Only show this to the driver. Nobody  else. And don't lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She maneuvers him into the end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes some of the paper money out of her wallet and s it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. Do what I told you  and you'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line moves forward a step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm going to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I have a long ride ahead of  me... (takes his hand) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhaydn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny comes back and takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay till you get on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family of four climbs aboard and the line moves up. The STAR MAN is alert to everything happening on the platform Jenny sneaks him an affectionate look. No one in front of him has baggage to check and they move quickly past the D until the STAR MAN is next in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN hands the Driver his ticket. The Driver rips out the first coupon and hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? You're going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they stop at the door, she impulsively kisses him on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his cheek) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a kiss... (she motions for him  to get on the bus) Goodbye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN climbs the steps just ahead of him. The door closes. Its ENGINE REVVING, the bus backs out of its stal Jenny catches a glimpse of the STAR MAN bent over in the  aisle looking out at her. She waves until the bus rounds building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's green Mustang loops around the end of a row of ca and heads for the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING OVER Jenny's SHOULDER, we SEE the Star Man waitin for her at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops next to him and rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny moans and lays her head on the vinyl of the window  sill. When she raises up, he smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you win. Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin is standing next to the security guard in the mid of a knot of shouting people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kind of thing's real bad for  business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't even speak English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those kind of people should be shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he was just lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's side are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way he was going to get away from  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in on a lapel mike pinned to the front of Shermin shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hubbub in the shopping center is being recorded on a  tape deck. Lyman, a phone to his ear, is seated in front the television screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?... And it was one  person, one way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and heads for the rear door. Jenny Haydn's cu Visa statement occupies the upper left screen. The last t items are circled: The charge for the Greyhound ticket an the credit for the return of that ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard tags Shermin into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyewitnesses are the worst. You get  two of them together. You got three  stories. You know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin sees Lyman come out of the crowd surrounding the  police cars in front of the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a reward in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?... Eh... no, there isn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm the one who called the  police, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. We appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's none of my business why  you're chasing a retard... You want  my opinion, it's the girl. She had  to hold the guy's hand all the way  to the car like he was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... he didn't look like no big  time criminal to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyman meets them. It is obvious he has something to tell  Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh... the store tells you to call  when there's trouble, so they won't  get sued... But that shouldn't matter  if there's a reward, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peeling off) That's what I thought. So remember  it was me because sometimes rewards  come late, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. (he turns to Lyman) Something's wrong here. She's helping  him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) I know. She bought him a ticket for  Lathrop Wells and put him on the  bus. He didn't stay on though and  they drove off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's turned her into one of  them. They enter the crowd around  the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang cruises along between fields of corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did your ship land on this  planet... on Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following conversation will be played over various vi of Americana: a station wagon load of kids, waving and  laughing, lovers kissing at a bus stop, billboards, car l a dog taking a leak against a tree, cheerleaders practici on a football field, a funeral cortege, a telephone repai up on a pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought we were a different  planet?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. My ship was doing a map of all  the suns and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stars... When a sun is far away, we  call it a 'star.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were doing a map of the stars and  all the other things up there when  we saw a small ship. My... eh... we  kidnapped it. On it there was a map  that said how to come to Earth. This  was very important. Before then, we  thought we were the only people in  all the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did? That's funny. So did we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told our home, and the people who  tell us what to do on my planet said  to come and look but not to talk,  not to land, not to shoot. Just to  look from up there. We came and...  the driver of my ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captain wanted to land to see  close and to get some things from  Earth to take home. The police came  and shot at us. One of the people  from my ship was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's terrible. I'm sorry. Was  he a good friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand 'friend.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend is a person that is good to  you... someone you like to be with...  someone you like to laugh with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a good friend... The captain  took the ship away fast and I was  not in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police shouldn't have started  shooting. But you can hardly blame  them. You surprised them. They didn't  know you were up there. When they  saw you, they thought you were here  to hurt us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like your captain's going to  get hell when he gets back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Jenny feels the STAR MAN staring at her. She turns look at him. His gaze doesn't waver. She looks back at th road, then back at the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you my friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I am your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's Mustang is whipping west out of Lincoln, Nebraska We HEAR A JUMBLE OF RADIO STATIONS as the SELECTOR is RUN THROUGH THE FREQUENCIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is driving. The STAR MAN finds a RELIGIOUS STATION the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) God is your creator. God is your  master. God is you savior. God is  the only reason that you exist. If  God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (during the above) Who is God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is tired. She doesn't want to get into that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN lets it drop and finds a COUNTRY AND WESTERN STATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like this music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've noticed... Do you understand  what they're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all... but it feels like a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny smiles at him, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have music up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear it. Can you sing  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid... I'd really like  to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She TURNS OFF the RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her, clears his throat and begins. His singing is like nothing we have ever heard. Vibrations of tones and glottal stops blend into a haunting, seductive  fugue. The STAR MAN stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a good singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) You liked my singing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Sing some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the STAR MAN's SERENADE WAFTING over the Nebraska pl we FALL BACK TO FIND a Highway Patrol car tagging along a safe distance behind the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN stops the Mustang in front of the office. He and Jenny get out and go inside. As the door closes on th three Nebraska Highway Patrol cars speed up the off-ramp. The lead car turns right on a surface street and enters t motel parking lot at the far end. The middle car goes straight across the intersection and  positions itself at the curb next to the driveway, giving access to a frontage road which leads to an on-ramp. The  last car also turns right on the surface street, but park in a restaurant parking lot directly across from the offi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In answer to Jenny's bell, the night CLERK comes out of t living quarters in the back, finger combing his sleep-rum hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you folks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much are your rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-seven fifty for one person,  forty-nine fifty for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawn by the bright colors on their covers, the STAR MAN  wanders over to the magazine rack. By chance, he selects copy of 'Playgirl' and begins to look through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have one with two beds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slides her a  registration card) Fill this out. (as Jenny writes) Will this be cash or credit card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to run your card off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (digging through her  purse) We're only going to be here a few  hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still the full price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind the STAR MAN, we WATCH Jenny react to the ope Playgirl centerfold that he is holding up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have never seen this before. I  am not complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although we cannot see it, we know what he is pointing at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN swivels the picture around so that he can se it. Jenny hands the smirking Clerk her credit card. He st to the side and inserts it into the imprinter. Out of the corner of his eye, he sees a dot of light leave the STAR  MAN's forehead to drop behind the magazine and into his  trousers. The Clerk glances over at Jenny to see if she hears the  HISSING that is going on behind the STAR MAN's fly. She d and she hopes it'll stop soon. His eyes on the STAR MAN, Clerk fumbles the key to 117 off the rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can park your car in front of  the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the key on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through his side window, the DRIVER can see the motel off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone of  his radio) What did these two do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All anybody knows is that they're  armed and dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the office, he can see Jenny and the STAR MAN leave th counter and head for the door. He raises a pair of binocu to his eyes for a good head-on look at them.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: We SEE Jenny and the STAR MAN come out of the motel offic

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Second Officer lowers the glasses and looks down at t telex pictures of Jenny and the STAR MAN taped to the  dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a piece of cake for us to take  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the WINDSHIELD, we can SEE Jenny and the STAR MAN approaching the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Security folks should be  here any minute. Let them take care  of it. That's what they get the big  bucks for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a drink. May I have two  quarters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the passenger door, Jenny sets her purse on the car ro to take out her wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing it to him) You shouldn't drink so much of that  stuff. It's bad for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the radio they say it's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over her purse she notices the patrol car facing her from the restaurant parking lot. There is certainly nothing un about a patrol car in a restaurant parking lot. She shrug it off and gets in the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's behind hasn't even hit the seat before she sees t patrol car parked on the frontage road off to her left. S looks at the STAR MAN. He's busy pounding on the drink  machine. She turns around to check the lot behind her and spots the patrol car there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming to the car  with a drink can in  each hand) The machine gave me two. Should I  put one back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rounding the hood) You can have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he gets in) I'm not sleepy anymore. Let's drive  for a little while longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN stiffens when he sees the patrol car on the  frontage road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you angry at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm just not tired. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang moves toward the frontage road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the Mustang rolls  onto the frontage  road) They made us. Let's get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three patrol cars jam on their rack lights and, with  their SIRENS HOWLING, peel out after Jenny and the STAR M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the SOUND, the STAR MAN snaps his attention to the rea view mirror. It's ablaze with police lights. He tromps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin is patched into the Nebraska Highway Patrol and i listening to the pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang careens down the on-ramp and squeezes into th traffic a hair's breath ahead of an 18-wheeler. This cuts off the patrol cars momentarily, but the Mustang doesn't  have the speed to stay ahead of them. Using the other car on the road as shields, the STAR MAN dodges from lane to  lane trying to keep the police from coming alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead patrol car feints forward on the STAR MAN's side The STAR MAN sways over to cut it off and the middle patr car slips in next to Jenny. The STAR MAN grabs the gun fr under the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a gun!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny screams. A shotgun blast from the middle patrol car rips through t door and into Jenny. Part of the FRONT WINDOW is BLOWN OU Bleeding badly, she slumps against the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhaydn! Jennyhaydn!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyelids flutter open and she tries to speak, but can' The middle patrol car is lining up for another shot. The  STAR MAN slams the Mustang into it, sending it spinning o the shoulder and into a ditch. The last patrol car speeds up to replace it. The lead pat car slips in next to the STAR MAN. They've got him in a  sandwich. The STAR MAN stands on his brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught by surprise, the patrol cars rocket ahead of him. Mustang cuts across the swatch of land that acts as a cen divider in the highway and races west in the eastbound la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN squints against the headlights of the on-com traffic as he calmly wedges his way straight through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead patrol car tries to follow him but is clipped by Cadillac swerving to avoid the STAR MAN and bounced back  into the center divider. The last patrol car parallels th Mustang in the westbound lanes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN realizes he's still boxed in. A car carrier  swerves by on his left. The lane behind is open. The STAR MAN takes advantage of the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang vaults off the shoulder of the highway into a open field and bullets away through the weeds. The rush of oncoming traffic traps the three patrol cars the center divider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny moans as the car jostles over the rough ground. The STAR MAN puts out a hand to cushion her ride. His headlig pick up a gravel road splitting the field and he turns on it. In a quick look back, he sees the patrol car shooting across the highway after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW the Mustang as it winds upward through the graz lands sparsely dotted with clumps of trees. The plume of  dust kicked up by the fleeing car is turned silver by a f moon. The WAIL OF the PATROL CARS is DISTANT BUT CLOSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang barrels around a curve and slides to a surpri stop before a gate in a barbed wire fence that ends the r With the .45 in his hand, the STAR MAN jumps out of the c and tries the gate. It is locked. When he turns back to the car, he sees something that  frightens him more than the approaching patrol cars. A  helicopter has joined the chase. He looks for a place to  hide. A stand of cottonwood and elm fifty yards on the ot side of the gate offers the only protection. The STAR MAN opens the passenger door. Jenny is soaked in her own blood. He hooks the strap of her purse over his  shoulder, lifts her tenderly and, cradling her in his arm wiggles between a fence post and the gate and jogs into t trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter sets down behind the Mustang. Shermin lead Bell, Lyman and the technicians to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing the blood on  the passenger seat) One of them must be pretty badly  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin pushes the seat forward. The STAR MAN's life-supp suit is stuffed in the space behind it. The patrol cars s around the curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bell, indicating  the suit) Get this back to the copter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin takes a bullhorn from Lyman and goes around to th front of the Mustang. The highway patrolmen get out of th cars behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bullhorn to woods) Mrs. Haydn, please come out. We don't  want to hurt you or your friend.  Please put down your weapon and come  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's limp weight is beginning to slow the STAR MAN. He hears the bullhorn but doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin lowers the bullhorn and speaks to the patrolmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fan out. These people have a  gun but we want them alive.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep shadow on the other side of an elm offers a likely hiding place. He moves through the underbrush toward it.  Without warning, his feet begin to slip out from under hi He struggles to regain his balance. When he does he looks down to find himself staring at a R RIVER 150 feet below. The bank on the other side is just few feet above the water and in the moonlight he can see flat plain cut by a highway that stretches into the dista Slowly, he backs away from the edge of the cliff. From under the elm he watches the helicopter sweep out ov the ravine. Its searchlight darts toward him bleaching th treeline. The overhanging branches cloak him and Jenny an the light passes without picking them up. The STAR MAN ad his grip on Jenny and starts off in the opposite directio from the helicopter to look for a way down the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin, his people and the patrolmen are combing the woo with flashlights in a picketline search. The Third Driver stops at the mouth of a clearing that runs between the  cottonwood and elm to the cliff. He takes a bite off a bl of chewing tobacco. As he replaces it in his pocket, he sees a shadow flit ac the far end of the clearing. He swings his flashlight in  that direction. The beam catches a piece of Jenny and the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! They're over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on the rim of the gorge, the STAR MAN sees the r of his pursuers' flashlights choking off any possible esc He eases Jenny to the ground behind a boulder. She whimpe with the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strokes her cheek) You will be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stretches over the top of the boulder and scatters FOU SHOTS at the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrolmen, the technicians and Shermin all hit the gr and kill their lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Haydn, we don't want to hurt  you. Put down your gun and come out.  We just want to talk to your friend.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAR MAN AND JENNY
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN peers around the boulder. At that instant th searchlight from the helicopter happens to splash across men in the field. He sees that their guns are drawn and  pointed in his direction. The STAR MAN pulls back and tak a marble from his pouch. It grows and glows gold as the S MAN rolls it between his palms. When it reaches the size a baseball, he clutches it firmly in his right hand and  EMPTIES the .45 toward Shermin and the police. This time, there is a BARRAGE OF ANSWERING FIRE. With the BULLETS RICOCHETING around him, the STAR MAN lif Jenny to his shoulder. He massages the golden orb until i becomes the size of a soccer ball, then takes two quick s to the edge of the cliff and leaps into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The upward thrust of the ball supports their fall and und its glow they begin a slow descent to the other side of t river. Above them, the helicopter dips back and locks its searchlight on the shelf of boulders they just left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN sets down with the smoothness of a man stepp off an escalator. He looks over his shoulder. The helicop is still concentrating its spotlight on the ridge. He spe to the ball in his language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitles) Iron channel message. Almost caught  by pursuers. This may hinder escape.  Wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets the ball go and, with even more velocity than the others, it zips into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN in a Frederick's of Hollywood negligee lets a TRU DRIVER out of one of the Winnebagos parked to the side of the main building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to tell the boys where  you had a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back to her) You weren't that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her rusty laugh follows him into the parking lot. He walk between the trucks to a semi which has half of a pre-fab  mobile home tied onto its flat-bed. The polyethylene that covers the open side of the house flaps in the WIND at th lower corner next to the cab. The Driver opens his door. takes out a staple gun and refastens the dark green plast to the house frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the empty bedroom, the STAR MAN tries to cushion Jenny against the sudden JOLTS made by the semi a it lumbers out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the Driver taking it smoothly through the gears, the semi picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN moves Jenny into a rectangle of moonlight sh on the floor by a high, wide window and strips off her bl The cold light marbles Jenny's skin and makes the blood f her wounds appear black. With her blouse, the STAR MAN wi away the blood on the right side of her head and neck. He finds a deep glass cut on her cheek and two entry points her neck. He concentrates on her cheek and we can SEE the glow of his brain through his human skin. A bit of the white light comes out of his forehead. It tu across to Jenny's cheek and settles into the wound. The S MAN watches intently as one end of the wound flares brigh for an instant, then dies. The flesh left behind has been closed without a scar. A larger piece of light drops out of his forehead into wh left of the gash. With that area suffused in a healing gl he shifts his focus to the pellet holes on her neck. He s two pieces of light plunging into the wounds. Immediately they spread into halos which we can SEE radiating from un the skin. Out of the night comes a LONG BLAST ON the AIR HORN and t STAR MAN has to steady Jenny as the truck swerves around  something in the highway. When it settles back into its ride, the STAR MAN wipes th blood off Jenny's shoulder. The beams of the passing cars through the plastic catch the fatigue on the STAR MAN's f as he works over Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With its pre-fab house, the semi rumbles through Julesbur Sterling and Ft. Morgan. By the time it gets to Denver, d is beginning to color the tips of the Rocky Mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still dark in here. With a chunk of light in his lef hand, the STAR MAN dabs at the last of Jenny's wounds, le behind a phosphorescent bandage. More of these patches gl up and down her right side. He checks her over to see if  he's missed a wound. He hasn't. He covers her with his windbreaker and, exhausted by his  efforts, sits back against the wall. He waits to see that Jenny is sleeping comfortably, then presses the palms of hands together. The satel compass appears between them. T green dot tells him he is still on course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colorado Highway PATROLMEN are dropping orange fluorescen cones across two of the three westbound lanes to form a  roadblock. The sound of a harmonica draws us to Shermin's helicopter parked in a meadow beside the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the radio technician plays the harmonica, Lyman clangs down the steps and bends to wake Shermin who is sacked ou under the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I'm not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin sighs and rolls over on his back. He looks terrib

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a radio. At least I won't  have to look at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin is holding a field radio to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're growing very concerned back  here. There's no use pretending  otherwise. We're rapidly approaching  a 'condition red.' People are  beginning to ask difficult questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make this as simple as I can,  George. They disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care where you're from you  just can't disappear into thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a punchy  hysterical laugh) George, listen to what you're saying.  This thing's changed itself into a  man. Disappearing may not be that  big a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far you've let it cross the heart  of America. For two days it has been  absorbing information that is  detrimental to our security. I don't  see the humor in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stung, Shermin takes a deep breath, controls himself and  returns the radio to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... look, this is just something  to think about... from what I got at  the shopping center, it was more  scared than anything else... I don't  feel it's as big a threat as you  think it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what's affecting your  performance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not being unpatriotic, and I'm  doing my damndest to catch them.  Bell's up on 80 and I'm down here on  70 past Grand Junction. They're  heading west. If they're not flying  we have a damn good chance of getting  them. All I'm asking is that you  people think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just do your job, Shermin. We'll  make the policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The semi is in the slow lane. Its right rear turn signal  blinks steadily telling US that it is leaving the highway and going north at the intersection ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny stirs awake under the windbreaker in the bedroom as sloppy DOWNSHIFT JOLTS the house. Her eyes flutter open a she looks around the room trying to figure out where she The truck leans into the turn. Jenny braces herself on on arm and sits up. Catching the windbreaker as it slips off her front, she  remembers that she was shot and examines her right side. runs her fingers over her cheek and neck, across her shou and down her side, feeling for traces of the wounds she k she sustained. She has been completely healed and there a no scars. She leans forward and looks down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WIND snapping the polyethylene is the only answer she gets. She picks her blouse off the floor next to her purs but throws it aside and shrugs into the windbreaker when sees the blood and bullet holes. Her sudden rise to a standing position makes her light-he and she has to lean against the doorway until the spinnin stops. With her hands outstretched, as guards against the sway of the truck, Jenny shuffles down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one in the kitchen and she continues into the living room. It is empty. Jenny opens the door to an encl back porch. It is also empty. The STAR MAN is gone. She  returns to the living room and stands there not really kn what to do next. The countryside rushes by outside a floo to-ceiling picture window. A WAIL FROM the semi's AIR HORN jars Jenny out of her rev and she goes to press her cheek against the window. She i looking past her left hand at the road when she notices a wide green ring on her finger above her wedding band. She steps back from the window to examine it, then with some  trepidation, twists it off. As it clears the end of her  finger, the STAR MAN's VOICE SPEAKS OUT OF IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennyhay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny drops the ring as if she'd been stung. The STAR MAN voice stops as soon as she does and the ring bounces acro the floor until it hits the baseboard. It looks innocent  enough lying there, but Jenny has a great deal of trouble making herself approach it. When she finally picks it up, it does nothing. She turns in her hand and when the side of the ring hole that was f her when she took the ring off faces her again, the STAR  MAN's VOICE CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nd. You are all fixed. I'm sorry  you were shot. I was a big problem  for you. Thank you for your help. I  can go to my ship alone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The semi is picking up speed as it heads north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver checks his side view mirror to see if the lane next to him is clear and is astonished to see a woman's a sticking out of the polyethylene waving a blouse at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke billows from under the tires as the semi skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny, her purse over her shoulder, is running toward the cab as the Driver steps out with a wrench in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you stop last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you stop last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay right there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your last stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elmo's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five miles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny's thumb is already out for a ride as she sprints ac the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting after her) Are there any more in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passing car TAKES US TO the STAR MAN as he runs along t shoulder to a maroon and white '57 Chevy that has pulled to pick him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swarthy, bald MAN with hairy arms leans across the seat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Las Vegas, please. I do not speak  English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hop in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re-entering the flow  of traffic) I can only take you to Grand Junction,  but you'll have a better chance to  get a ride from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN starts to point to the sky, then catches him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parlez vous Francais?... Habla  Ingles?... Sprechen zie deutsch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are foreign words to the STAR MAN and he pastes on smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, neither do I. What do you  do for a living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending) I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a cook. Do you understand 'cook?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food. Eat. I prepare food. I work as  a cook. That's how I make money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searches for an  answer, then) I make maps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that sounds interesting. You  like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make any money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a pack of Camels  out of his pocket) You don't get rich as a cook, either,  believe me. I got a girl going to  college this fall. The wife had to  go back to nursing to help pay for  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks a cigarette in his mouth and flips one up for t STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN takes it, quickly examines it, then position it in his mouth at the exact angle the Cook did. His eyeb raise when the Cook flicks his Bic and puffs an ash on th end of his cigarette. The butane flame is swung in his direction and he flinche back before allowing the Cook to singe his Camel. He copi the Cook's puffing and the end of his cigarette begins to glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to become a doctor. She's  a bright kid. Hard worker. I think  she'll make it. But the damned  inflation's driven the tuition up so  high it makes it real tough on a  family like ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook inhales deeply from his cigarette and blows smok at the windshield. The STAR MAN mimics the inhalation, th chokes. His eyes bulge and his cheeks puff out as he trie to be cool and not cough. The Cook takes no notice of his struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got two other kids. I don't know  what we'll do when they get old enough  for college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke starts to dribble out of the Star Man's nose and mo Puzzled, he re-examines his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody blames it on the oil crisis.  That might be where it starts. But I  think a lot of people are just using  that as an excuse to rip the rest of  us off. I see it every day in the  kitchen. Peaches. We use the gallon  cans. The price has gone up three  times in the last year. And now the  cans are only half full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook takes another drag. As if etiquette required it, the STAR MAN hurries to copy him. This time there are no effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're damned expensive and a pain  in the ass sometimes, but I wouldn't  trade having them for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook flicks his ash out of the window. A moment later the STAR MAN mirrors his action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck stop set back as little as the law allows from th BUZZ OF INTERSTATE 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for a guy about this  tall, with brown hair and really  gray eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FIND Jenny at the set of fuel pumps nearest the highwa dogging an ATTENDANT while he services an 18-wheeler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had on tan cords, a plaid shirt  and a baseball cap... probably  hitchhiking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't pay much attention to those  guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out her wallet) In the last hour or so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny folds back the plastic windows to the picture of he husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Jenny as she wends her way through the trucks  questioning other attendants. The RUMBLE OF TRAFFIC DROWN OUT their CONVERSATION, but the answer is always the same Finally, we FOLLOW the picture as Jenny hands it up to an ATTENDANT cleaning the windshield on a Peterbilt cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at picture) I don't know... I'm not sure. I might  have seen him up the road a piece on  my way in. He's long gone by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the snapshot back to Jenny. She nods a 'thank yo and looks wistfully around the yard. There is nothing she can do. Fitting the picture back into her wallet, she wal away. After a few steps she turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know if anybody here's going to  Wisconsin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bustling, loud and smoky. Jenny is standing just ins the entrance. She licks her lips and tries to clear the f out of her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (small voice) Anybody going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody pays any attention to her. Her voice trails off. S swallows hard and tries again, this time booming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody going to Wisconsin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The activity in the diner comes to a screeching halt and the silence Jenny adds in a normal voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER MAN, with a face seamed by cigarettes and weathe waves at her from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to Des Moines. If you can  wait till I finish here, you're  welcome to ride along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets some good-humored cheers and catcalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling self-consciously, she takes a seat at the end of counter and orders coffee from the waitress. While she is waiting for it to come, she happens to glance outside and sees a Colorado Highway patrol car stopped in the yard. The officer on the passenger side is talking to one of th attendants. Jenny turns away from the window and finds th she is able to watch the conversation in a strip of mirro that runs around the top of the pie case. The squad car l and her coffee arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waitress) Where's the phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny drops a dime in the slot and dials 'O.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator... may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you give me the highway patrol,  please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After TWO RINGS, the phone is picked up on the other end the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Packert, Highway Patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Jenny Haydn. I think you're  looking for me. I was kidnapped in  Eau Claire, Wisconsin a couple of  days ago. But I'm free now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your name again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny Haydn. I'm on my way home and  I don't want anybody I'm with shot  at when you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing back of the officers, Shermin watches them check cars passing through the squeeze point. Every car trunk i opened. Vans and campers are looked into. Lyman runs up and whispers in Shermin's ear. Shermin is  startled by what he hears. He leaves Lyman in charge and  hurries to the helicopter parked in the field beside the  roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TECHNICIAN gives Shermin a headset phone as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
