dialogues.text: (hand over the mouth- piece) You trace it yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we know right now is that it's  east of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin puts on the headset and the technician starts a t recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Marc Shermin. Where are you,  Mrs. Haydn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Someplace called Elmo's.  Look, I just wanted to tell you that  I'm all right and I'm on my way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been through quite an ordeal,  Mrs. Haydn. Why don't you stay where  you are and let us pick you up? We'll  fly you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You'll want to ask a lot of  questions I don't want to answer  right now. I already have a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Technician hands Shermin a note which reads: ELMO"S T STOP/ABOUT 30 MILES EAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only called to tell you I was free  and not to shoot anybody I was with  if you see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin jabs his thumb upward, indicating that the helico should lift off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the man who kidnapped you there  now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. He let me go. I'm on my  way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his hand over the  mouthpiece) Get a highway patrol unit over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's helicopter lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Haydn, I'm going to have to ask  you to stay where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sharp rap on the glass startles Jenny and she turns aro to see her ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny holds up a finger that asks for a moment longer on phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mr... I'm sorry, what was your name  again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marc Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shermin, I'm hanging up now. If  you want to ask me any questions,  call me at home in a couple of days.  I'm in the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you were kidnapped  by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Haydn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want to hurt anybody.  Please leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he on his way to Lathrop Wells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits Jenny like a kick in the stomach. She leans her head back against the wall. Her ride is pacing outside th booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he planning to do in Lathrop  Wells? Is he meeting someone there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny smashes the receiver back in its cradle and throws  open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on her way past the  weathered driver) I changed my mind. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes down the hallway to the dining area where agai she stands just inside the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the top of her  lungs) It's me again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place goes quiet except for a smattering of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a fast ride west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speedometer reads 90. The driver, a bespectacled, pim faced SIXTEEN YEAR OLD, shifts into fifth gear. Jenny is  harnessed in the passenger seat. Chatter from a CB under dash COMPETES WITH ROCK N' ROLL ON THE TAPE DECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is your car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a stutter) My grandmother's rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they come up on a  station wagon) Slow down, slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, Mrs. Haydn, we just got going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he downshifts. The Porsche is going a mere 80 when th pass the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering at its  occupants) I told you I'm looking for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cars, too?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be a real drag. I  thought you wanted to go fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howling at full throttle, three highway patrol cars rush  past them in the opposite direction. Jenny swivels around follow their progress until they are out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They after you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his stutter thicker  than before) Would be kinda neat if they were. I  think I could outrun them. Maybe get  my picture in the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny takes a second look at this guy. He flashes her a g toothed grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook's '57 Chevy makes a left on the street intersect the off-ramp and stops at the curb. Behind it a large pla yellow chicken twirls on a pole above the restaurant it  advertises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here we are... You go down  that ramp there, you're sure to get  a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't be shy about your English.  You speak better than a lot of people  I know. (leaving) Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an afterthought, the STAR MAN duplicates the Cook's wa then heads down the ramp. As he clears the frame, our VIE ZOOMS AND ZOOMS AND ZOOMS UNTIL we can SEE a piece of the roadblock in the valley below him. During the MOVE-IN, we BEGIN TO PICK UP CB CHATTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash for all you good buddies heading  west on 70. Smoky's got a roadblock  just beyond Grand Junction... Better  dump your dope, they're going through  everything... He's right. I was just  there and I'm still sore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny TURNS DOWN the ROCK 'N ROLL to listen to the CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah loves to be frisked! What are  they looking for? I'm holding. Any  way around it? Where are you? Oh  no!! There it is!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you we find your friend at the  roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny doesn't answer immediately. She takes her time chec out the people in a VW they are passing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the road ahead) We better find him before that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the style prescribed by Jenny, the STAR MAN raises his thumb to a dilapidated Vega shimmying down the on-ramp. T two blue-haired ladies inside are afraid to look at him a they go by. He has the same luck with an attractive blond secretary that passes on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A highway PATROLMAN is standing behind the open door of h car speaking into the mike of his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl's not here, Mr. Shermin.  Seems right after she talked to you,  she got a ride west with a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All six TV screens display the road rushing under it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mouthpiece of  his headset) You get that, Lyman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's S65 banks through a U-turn and chases west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dun-colored Roadrunner gurgles down the ramp and stops front of the STAR MAN. Two grubby LONG HAIRS in worn west clothes are inside with boxes of house-hold utensils and  duffle bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Las Vegas, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his buddy stretched on the jumble in the back The buddy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Get in. We can drop you in  Vegas or get you darn close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN opens the door and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CB CONTINUES TO CRACKLE with news of the roadblock.  Jenny's eyes restlessly search the overpass under the whi yellow chicken for any sign of the STAR MAN. She sees the dun-colored Roadrunner waiting at the foot of the on-ramp for a break in the traffic, but she is too far away to se who's inside. As the Porsche gets closer, it overtakes an wheeler and Jenny's view of the Roadrunner is cut off  entirely. She passes without seeing the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche weaves through the traffic giving Jenny a cha to look into the cars and trucks it shoots by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is turned around looking back at a camper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, you're going to  find him at the roadblock, or right  after, or not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he didn't want to go through the  roadblock, is there any other way to  get to Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny gives him a withering look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five-fifty. We already passed  it. But it'll take him way out of  his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull over. I've got to get back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't he want to go through  the roadblock?... What did you guys  do?... I won't tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easier not to tell if you don't  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche slows to a stop on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Jenny opens the  door) Wait. Could I have your autograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans back and gives the startled Teenager a kiss on mouth, then gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing to do. I'd like to  help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door. The Teenager takes a last look at he before pulling back on the highway. Jenny waits for a car the slow lane to go by, then runs across to the line and  waits for cars in the fast lane to go by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN spots Jenny standing on the line peering int the on-coming cars for signs of him. He becomes agitated his mouth begins to move soundlessly. There is a break in the traffic and Jenny dashes to the center divider. The S MAN leans across his driver and yells as the Roadrunner  plunges by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNYHAYDN!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny spins around to see the Roadrunner skid to a stop o the shoulder and the STAR MAN get out. A motorcycle bombs by. He starts across the lanes of traffic toward Jenny. A truck blasts past him in the slow lane. He is buffeted in the fast lane. Jenny runs down the center divider to meet him. A VW honks, its tires squeal on the pavement as it  swerves around him. He reaches the safety of the center  divider. Jenny throws her arms around him and lays her he against his chest. He stands there uncomfortably not know how to respond to this human emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you goodbye. Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are waiting for you up  ahead. There's a roadblock. You have  to go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This car will take me to Las Vegas.  I cannot go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police know about Lathrop Wells.  We have to go another way. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his wrist but he hangs back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't meet the ship, my people  will go home without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please understand. If you go this  way, you'll never get to your ship.  The police know about Lathrop Wells.  We have to go another way. I'll get  you to your ship. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will go. But not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shit! I'll decide if I go or  not. Not you. I don't know what you  do on your planet, but I didn't think  that was very nice walking out on me  like you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to be hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the STAR MAN's hand, Jenny pulls him toward the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask to come along on this  trip, but I sure as hell am going to  be the one to say when I get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They bolt across the lanes of traffic to the other side o the road where she flags down an old black pickup truck. says something to the driver and she and the STAR MAN cli into the back. As the truck returns to the highway, the C OF AN APPROACHING HELICOPTER OVERPOWERS the TRAFFIC SOUND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's helicopter slices around a pine-dotted peak  following the twists of Interstate 70 below. In the near  distance, we can SEE the roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnoticed by Shermin or the Technicians, the black pickup passes off the television screens carrying their quarry e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset) Any sign of either of them yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roadblock appears on the television screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyman, wearing a headset plugged into a belt pack, is wal down the line of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they're going to show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swift kick from Shermin sends a stool clanging into a  bulkhead. The Technicians won't meet his eyes when he tur back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Tell the highway patrol to  block all major arteries off 70 from  here to Elmo's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two highway patrol cars scatter the traffic in front of t with their rack lights and SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and the STAR MAN are sitting against the cab, a hor blanket drawn up around their shoulders. They can see the flashing lights coming from way down the road and watch  helplessly as the patrol cars eat up the distance between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup makes the turn onto Highway 550.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Jenny and the STAR MAN think they're safe.  That hope turns to despair when the two patrol cars loop  after them. They keep getting closer. The STAR MAN inches the blanket up over his nose. Unexpectedly, the patrol ca are thrown into a skid. When they stop, they are facing e other ready to inspect the traffic coming off 70. They lo the blanket from their faces. Jenny lays her head back ag the cab, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cook said I speak good English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUMBLE OF DISTANT THUNDER follows the lightning that fl from the dark clouds hanging on the horizon. Looking  incomplete without its trailer, the tractor/cab of a Mack truck makes a turn on a farm road, revealing Jenny and th STAR MAN standing on the gravel. The STAR MAN looks back where they came from. There is nothing coming so he sets in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must meet my ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't we wait here for a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel better if I move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hundreds of miles from where  you have to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN ignores her and continues to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts at him) Even if we walk five miles, it's not  going to make any difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny turns toward an oncoming car and sticks out her thu The STAR MAN falls into the same pose just back of her. T car honks at them as it breezes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams after it) Asshole!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Where did you learn that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A torrential rainstorm lashes the countryside. The STAR M and Jenny splash along the edge of the asphalt. Their hea are lowered against the weather. They are both drenched t the skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a few steps) We're not going to get a ride tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay on this planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's traveling in this weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised you would get me to my  ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts after him) I will. I will. We still have another  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? There are  no cars on this road. I didn't ask  for this stupid storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN mutters in his language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop. I will go on alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too far away to walk. Don't  you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN looks at her. With the rain streaming off hi face, he looks at her. For the first time, the reality of the situation hits him. He turns and, swearing in his own language, flails at the rain. A distance from Jenny, he s and cries out in English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay here. I want to go home.  I don't want this skin. I don't want  to look like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny can see him standing with his head bowed. She walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to ease his  pain) Why don't you send one of your radio  balloons and tell your captain that  you might be late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used the last one to jump off the  cliff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's find a place out of the rain.  I'm sure we'll get a ride in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be late. I don't know if the  radio balloons work above your planet.  I don't know if my words went to the  ship. If I'm not there, the captain  will think I'm dead and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get a ride in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of lightning shows us:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and the STAR MAN are following the tracks to an  abandoned boxcar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN climbs in and pulls Jenny after him. Jenny i shivering badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you close the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN scrapes it forward. He activates the satel  compass which lights the interior of the boxcar. While he doing this Jenny turns her back to him and takes off her  jacket. Her teeth chattering, she tries to wring the wate out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're damn right I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not get cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching the windbreaker to her breasts, Jenny looks at STAR MAN over her shoulder. It doesn't take her long to m up her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to him) Open your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits while he struggles with the buttons. After two brushes away his hands and undoes the rest. She lets the  windbreaker drop and, slipping her arms around his waist, presses her bare chest against his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (savoring it) Oh, you're warm... put your arms  around me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN does and Jenny jumps as the wet sleeves touc her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is difficult with Jenny around his waist, but he manag He drapes his arms over her. She snuggles into him. The R POUNDS ON THE ROOF. Gradually, Jenny responds to the STAR MAN's warmth and relaxes. She lifts her head off his ches and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brushes her lips against his. The STAR MAN's not sure what's happening. But he's not offended. Her next kiss is full and long. He accepts it with his eyes open and when eases back he leans in for more. Jenny responds. As if on command, the satel compass comes from around behind the S MAN to hover in back of Jenny. He takes it between his pa and extinguishes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny awakens and looks around. The STAR MAN is not with  her. As she stands up she hears his VOICE OUTSIDE. He is  speaking to something in his language. She goes to the door to find out what and sees him standi beside a fenced-in pasture talking to the horses inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny joins the STAR MAN at the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't forget anything, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny pets one of the horses on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the horse) Hello... hello. How are you this  morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they talk?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) No, they don't talk... We talk to  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An appaloosa nudges her way through the others to the fen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're pretty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave you a baby last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked, Jenny looks at him from around the appaloosa's n The STAR MAN is combing a horse's mane with his fingers a he doesn't see her expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the horses) They are beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been very good to me,  Jennyhaydn. (turns to face her) You said you wanted a baby, so I  gave you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head 'no') But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be human and it will look  like this. (touches his face) But when it comes it will know  everything I know and everything you  know. That is something from my planet  that I want your baby to have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you it's impossible for me to  have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will have this baby. If you want  it. If you don't, I can stop it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny comes over and puts her arms around the STAR MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formation of six black Bell Cobra helicopters rush at u out of the blue. From above them we can see that they are heading for a small desert town. 'Welcome to Lathrop Well is spelled out on a hillside in white-washed stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grubby, unshaven and unwashed, Shermin, Bell, Lyman and t rest of the crew watch the seven Cobras land in sequence. Fox, immaculate in a freshly pressed black flight suit, c out of the first one down and he and Shermin meet in the  middle of the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a new directive. I'm taking  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scans the Cobras) We don't have to do it that way. We  can catch him this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington thinks it's too late for  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been taken off an  assignment in my life. Give me twenty- four hours and I'll have him for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hearing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can change a directive, George.  You've done it before. Listen to me.  He's going somewhere in Death Valley.  Lathrop Wells was never anything but  a bus stop. East is the nuclear site.  There are no roads in there. She was  teaching him to hitchhike. I'm telling  you. We block the four roads into  Death Valley and we got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do that. But how are we going  to hold him? He can change himself  into a man. He can disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the chance we have to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're going to have to do it  without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a career intelligence officer,  Shermin. You'll be in the air with  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about taking a life.  The most unique life form on this  planet. I think we're better than  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire-engine-red Pontiac convertible with two COWBOYS (l fifties) in the front and Jenny and the STAR MAN in the b moves with the traffic along the main drag in the downtow area. The STAR MAN's head swivels from side to side tryin to take in the neon that juts up around him. The converti stops at a light. The cowboy on the passenger side opens door and tips his hat to Jenny as she and the Star Man ge out of the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is afraid of the crush of people and wants t stay close to Jenny, but is fascinated by the whir and cl and jingle of the one-armed bandits that seem to be  everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this gambling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny nods. A LADY in curlers and pedal pushers hits a tw dollar jackpot. Hanging onto Jenny's hand the STAR MAN tu around and walks sideways to watch the quarters tumble ou into the lady's shopping bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cowboys were right. You can make  money fast gambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't make money gambling. You  lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN hangs back to examine a one-armed bandit ins the front door while Jenny goes to the counter. An almost imperceptible blue haze seems to seep from under the STAR MAN's palms as he runs his hands up and down the sides of the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the clerk) Do you have a good map of Death  Valley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have. Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the clerk searches for the map the STAR MAN comes u to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have twenty-five cents, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sighs and rolls her eyes and fishes two quarters ou of her purse and hands them to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are two quarters. When you lose  these, you're not going to get  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. (heading back to the  machine) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops a quarter into the slot and pulls the handle. Wh the pictures of fruit spin behind the view window, his ha stroke the sides of the machine. An orange, a pear and a  cherry stop in the view window. At the counter Jenny expl to the clerk that she is hitchhiking and wants the busies route into Death Valley without going through Lathrop Wel The STAR MAN looks long and hard at the machine before pu in his last quarter. He pulls the handle. The blue haze f from his palms, three cherries lock into a line and the o armed bandit begins to spit quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny is nervous about being here. She feels every face t looks at them could be a cop. The STAR MAN is pulling her through a Maginot Line of slot machines toward a 'Super  Jackpot' machine that advertises a $275,000 payoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. We don't have time  for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how to gamble now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won ten dollars. Big deal. If we  don't get a good ride before dark we  could miss your ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get money for you and the  baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need any money for the baby.  I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inflation, tuition, college. Children  are damned expensive. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cook again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping up to the  'Super Jackpot') Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I ever run into that guy, I'm  going to kick his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN pops a gleaming silver dollar into the machi pulls the handle and places his hands against the metal.  Jenny, knowing it can't work, but hoping that it will, st back and gnaws on her thumb. Then she sees the blue haze  vibrating out of the STAR MAN's palms. Jenny stifles a sc She looks around to see if anybody else has noticed. They haven't. The STAR MAN smiles at her. The force field does it's work. A picket line of 7's fills the view window. Am the jangle of bells and flashing lights that accompany a  winner Jenny doesn't know whether she should jump for joy hide her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dot in the distance becomes a brand new Camaro. As it b away from under us we see a paper license in its back win The cabin light is on inside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the passenger seat the STAR MAN is riffling through a  Columbia "History of the World." A Webster's Dictionary i on the dash in front of him. Wedged between his legs and transmission well is a shopping bag full of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll tell you pretty much everything  about us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is very interesting. We are  born knowing our history. We have  other books. But not a book like  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any words you don't know you can  find in the dictionary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll give you the different  countries, how they came to be, what  they are now, how America came to  be, the governments, the languages...  everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Many of my people will not believe  those things are possible. On my  planet there is only one government,  one people, one language. I will be  asked a lot of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you say about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will say that we can be friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices the green ring on her left hand and takes it  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is yours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to keep it, you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips it back on her finger above her wedding band. T drive in silence. The STAR MAN sets the history book on t dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes the ring off  again) Would you put some of your singing  in this for the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the baby to laugh at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the STAR MAN SINGING IN HIS LANGUAGE, the Camaro mov further into Death Valley. The SONG FADES and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro blows by a gas station, closed for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN shifts restlessly in his seat as he searches the ghostly landscape for something familiar. He activate the satel compass. The red and green dots are touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will it take you to get  home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently) Many, many days and nights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He presses the satel compass into his palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to listen to some  music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we could find a country and  western station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny takes his hand in hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Everything's going to  be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN smiles wanly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans forward to  look up at night sky) Which star is yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only takes the STAR MAN an instant to find his home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He directs Jenny's attention to the constellation Auriga.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning the star  Capella) The yellow one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow... I'll tell you what. When  the baby is born, we'll go out in my  back yard and wave to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I will wave to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All we can HEAR are the TIRES HUMMING over the road. The  Camaro rounds the side of a low hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny slams on the brakes. One of the Cobra helicopters, from the inside, is parked next to a line of flares acros the road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is looking through a window at the repair ba lit by a work light. Jenny is standing in a phone shell o the front of the garage, the receiver to her ear. The STAR MAN moves to the office door. He tries the knob. is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the STAR MAN) They're trying to get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the STAR MAN slams his shoulder against the door It swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox's voice comes out of the receiver in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Haydn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking into a  headset) This is George Fox...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak to Marc Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can speak to me, Mrs. Haydn. I'm  in charge of this operation now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't speak to Mr. Shermin, I'm  hanging up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tethered by the phone cord, Jenny tries to see what the S MAN is doing inside the repair bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using an air filter top as a basket, the STAR MAN scaveng from the work bench and the car up on the lift, fuses, le of wire, circuit boards from a radio, tubing, metal pipe a Black and Decker drill. While he is doing this we get  glimpses of Jenny pleading his case on the phone. Finally leaving the receiver dangling at the end of its cord, she comes around to stand in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shermin wants to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin looks warily at the headset. When the STAR MAN do speak immediately, he takes the initiative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must get to my ship, Mr. Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt anybody. I just  want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox is listening to the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the roads into Death Valley are  blocked. We'd like to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I talk to you, I will miss my  ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute... Let's take the  chance, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we can't let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN shaves the rubber off the electrical lines  leading into the fuse box and clips two wires of his own  onto the exposed copper. With Jenny watching we have a mo of the STAR MAN working through the night: modifying the  insides of the Black and Decker drill, cutting out the mi section above the trigger, fitting electrical components  into that area, screwing a pipe into the bit-clamp, weldi it together with the spark that arcs between the electric wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny folds a sheaf of money into a sheet of yellow paper and props it on the cash register. 'For Damages. Thank Yo is scribbled on the front. She runs out to catch the STAR MAN who is on his way to the Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the modified Black and Decker drill the STAR MAN opens the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jennyhaydn. You are good.  I must go alone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I would get you to your ship  and that's where we're going to say  goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both hands on the wheel, Jenny is burning down the center line. The STAR MAN bends two thin wires trailing out from the grip of the drill. Jenny winces as he buries them int the flesh on either side of his left wrist. The car skate around the corner of a low hill. They can see that the Co is still sitting next to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at the  modified drill) I hope that works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN is lost in concentration. Jenny kills her lights and glues the accelerator to the f Three MEN scramble from the helicopter with M16s. A BURST SLUGS RIPS THROUGH the Camaro's WINDSHIELD. The STAR MAN  leans out the passenger window and with an other-worldly  scream, fires. The helicopter is BLOWN TO SMITHEREENS. Th concussion throws the men to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro whizzes through the falling DEBRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN slumps in exhaustion and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know how many times I can  do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is filled with the radio voices of the Cobra crews set up to attack the Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro becomes airborne at the crest of a dip. Only i new shocks save the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN draws the satel compass out between his palm The green dot now covers the right half of the red dot. H presses his palms together and looks past Jenny at the ru foothills. The first light of day is starting to color the sky behin them. Jenny and the STAR MAN are startled by the DRUMMING WHOMP OF A HELICOPTER. The STAR MAN looks out the window its source. He can't see anything. The SOUND FADES. In a  moment, it is REPEATED ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CAR and A IT FADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my ship is not here, we are in  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a truism that Jenny doesn't want to hear and she  flexes her fingers on the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at a  distinctive cone  peak) That's where we landed last time.  Right under that mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and the STAR MAN steady themselves for the last leg their journey. Suddenly, their silence is exploded by a C dropping out of the sky in front of them. Its searchlight bangs into their faces and, with its thirty-calibre MACHI GUNS BLAZING, it comes straight at them. Jenny yanks the Camaro onto the shoulder. The SLUGS CHEW the asphalt beside it. She fishtails back onto the road. SECOND COBRA surprises them from the STAR MAN's side. Its MACHINE GUN KNOCKS OUT the BACK WINDOW before he can FIRE The STAR MAN crawls over his seat and arranges himself in the hole that was the back window to meet the Cobras' nex FIRING RUN. It doesn't take them long. The first two have been joined by a THIRD. They swoop down on the Camaro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunsights lock on the car below. The CO-PILOT squeeze the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS THUMP INTO the trunk in front of the STAR MAN and h FIRES. The lead HELICOPTER ERUPTS, raining pieces of hot  metal over the desert floor. The other helicopters are ja out of their run and their BULLETS harmlessly KICK UP SAN on the shoulder. Before they can regroup, the STAR MAN BL THEM OUT OF THE SKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front!!! In front!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN has to hang on as Jenny dodges the car out o the path of a Cobra skimming over the highway toward them As it goes over, he is able to get off a SHOT directly IN its UNDERBELLY. The BALL OF FLAME almost engulfs the Cama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN slumps down into the back seat breathing har Jenny looks over her shoulder at him and is shocked at th strain that shows on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws the car into a skid and leaves the blacktop fo dirt road winding between two low hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of a sandstone cliff, the Camaro slides to a  stop. Jenny helps the STAR MAN out. She supports him as t struggle toward the protection of the boulders. Fox's Cob roars over the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spots the car) Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN turns toward the Cobra. Weakly, he raises hi weapon and pulls the trigger. Nothing happens. The search from the Cobra finds them. Its machine guns begin to rais puffs of gravel around them. Jenny grabs the STAR MAN's a and pulls him into the relative safety of the rocks. The  STAR MAN collapses against the cool stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasps) I can't shoot anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny looks out between the crags. Shermin's helicopter  arrives to join the Cobra. With their searchlights flicki over the sagebrush, they move cautiously toward the cliff Jenny turns back to the STAR MAN. He is too weak to run  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his shoulder  lightly) I won't let anyone hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it. They're coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six images (close-up to full shot) of Jenny and the STAR stepping out of their hiding place fill the television sc in front of Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End it, Shermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyman taps his keyboard. The screens all change to a long shot of Jenny and the STAR MAN with cross-hairs superimpo on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's helicopter moves toward Jenny and the STAR MAN  standing helpless in the circle thrown by the searchlight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cross-hairs have locked on Jenny and the STAR MAN. Sh knows he can't do it. He picks up a headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George... Do you hear me, George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin!! Shermin!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin flips a switch on the console that cuts Fox off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his crew) Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin's helicopter passes over the heads of Jenny and t STAR MAN and rises into the dawn sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shermin!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws down his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pilot) Lock in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunsights lock in on Jenny and the STAR MAN. Fox's gr tightens on the trigger. Suddenly the helicopter begins t vibrate and drift off its target. Fox looks toward the so coming from his right and his eyes widen in fear as he se the STAR MAN's ship looming over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spacecraft passes over the top of the helicopter. The whirling downdraft emanating from the spaceship's underbe yanks the Cobra away from Jenny and the STAR MAN and whip it into a spin which gets faster and faster until it  disintegrates and falls to the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny and the STAR MAN shield their faces against the DUS STORM that billows under the WHINING DESCENT of the  spacecraft. It settles into a landing across the dirt roa resting on its three pods. With a crack, a cone of bright white light blasts from the underside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you love me and kiss me  'goodbye.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN puts his arms around her and holds her tight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her head on his  shoulder) I'm never going to see you again, am  I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses the tears out of her eyes, then full on the mou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STAR MAN steps back and places a hand on Jenny's stom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the baby about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns from her and walks to his ship. Jenny watches hi go, then remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets the Webster's Dictionary and the Columbia Histor of the World from the Camaro and runs to the STAR MAN. He takes them and kisses her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jennyhaydn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny backs away as the STAR MAN walks under the ship int the white light. He waves one last time to Jenny and is  swallowed into the ship by the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny turns away from the stinging sand as the space-craf lifts off. When she looks again, it is high and moving ov the foothills. A banking turn brings it back. The ship di low over her, rocks itself in a gesture of farewell, then shoots off into the stars. When she can no longer see it, Jenny drops her wave with a sigh and starts back toward t Camaro. Over her walk, we SUPER:
